When the high priest and his officials arrived , they convened the high council the full assembly of the elders of Israel . Then they sent for the apostles to be brought from the jail for trial .
44005022	But when the Temple guards went to the jail , the men were gone . So they returned to the council and reported ,
44005023	“ The jail was securely locked , with the guards standing outside , but when we opened the gates , no one was there ! ”
44005024	When the captain of the Temple guard and the leading priests heard this , they were perplexed , wondering where it would all end .
44005025	Then someone arrived with startling news : “ The men you put in jail are standing in the Temple , teaching the people ! ”
44005026	The captain went with his Temple guards and arrested the apostles , but without violence , for they were afraid the people would stone them .
44005027	Then they brought the apostles before the high council , where the high priest confronted them .
44005028	“ Didn’t we tell you never again to teach in this man’s name ? ” he demanded . “ Instead , you have filled all Jerusalem with your teaching about him , and you want to make us responsible for his death ! ”
44005029	But Peter and the apostles replied , “ We must obey God rather than any human authority .
44005030	The God of our ancestors raised Jesus from the dead after you killed him by hanging him on a cross .
44005031	Then God put him in the place of honor at his right hand as Prince and Savior . He did this so the people of Israel would repent of their sins and be forgiven .
44005032	We are witnesses of these things and so is the Holy Spirit , who is given by God to those who obey him . ”
44005033	When they heard this , the high council was furious and decided to kill them .
44005034	But one member , a Pharisee named Gamaliel , who was an expert in religious law and respected by all the people , stood up and ordered that the men be sent outside the council chamber for a while .
44005035	Then he said to his colleagues , “ Men of Israel , take care what you are planning to do to these men !
44005036	Some time ago there was that fellow Theudas , who pretended to be someone great . About 400 others joined him , but he was killed , and all his followers went their various ways . The whole movement came to nothing .
44005037	After him , at the time of the census , there was Judas of Galilee . He got people to follow him , but he was killed , too , and all his followers were scattered .
44005038	“ So my advice is , leave these men alone . Let them go . If they are planning and doing these things merely on their own , it will soon be overthrown .
44005039	But if it is from God , you will not be able to overthrow them . You may even find yourselves fighting against God ! ”
44005040	The others accepted his advice . They called in the apostles and had them flogged . Then they ordered them never again to speak in the name of Jesus , and they let them go .
44005041	The apostles left the high council rejoicing that God had counted them worthy to suffer disgrace for the name of Jesus .
44005042	And every day , in the Temple and from house to house , they continued to teach and preach this message : “ Jesus is the Messiah . ”
44006001	But as the believers rapidly multiplied , there were rumblings of discontent . The Greek-speaking believers complained about the Hebrew-speaking believers , saying that their widows were being discriminated against in the daily distribution of food .
44006002	So the Twelve called a meeting of all the believers . They said , “ We apostles should spend our time teaching the word of God , not running a food program .
44006003	And so , brothers , select seven men who are well respected and are full of the Spirit and wisdom . We will give them this responsibility .
44006004	Then we apostles can spend our time in prayer and teaching the word . ”
44006005	Everyone liked this idea , and they chose the following : Stephen ( a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit ) , Philip , Procorus , Nicanor , Timon , Parmenas , and Nicolas of Antioch ( an earlier convert to the Jewish faith ) .
44006006	These seven were presented to the apostles , who prayed for them as they laid their hands on them .
44006007	So God’s message continued to spread . The number of believers greatly increased in Jerusalem , and many of the Jewish priests were converted , too .
44006008	Stephen , a man full of God’s grace and power , performed amazing miracles and signs among the people .
44006009	But one day some men from the Synagogue of Freed Slaves , as it was called , started to debate with him . They were Jews from Cyrene , Alexandria , Cilicia , and the province of Asia .
44006010	None of them could stand against the wisdom and the Spirit with which Stephen spoke .
44006011	So they persuaded some men to lie about Stephen , saying , “ We heard him blaspheme Moses , and even God . ”
44006012	This roused the people , the elders , and the teachers of religious law . So they arrested Stephen and brought him before the high council .
44006013	The lying witnesses said , “ This man is always speaking against the holy Temple and against the law of Moses .
44006014	We have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy the Temple and change the customs Moses handed down to us . ”
44006015	At this point everyone in the high council stared at Stephen , because his face became as bright as an angel’s .
44007001	Then the high priest asked Stephen , “ Are these accusations true ? ”
44007002	This was Stephen’s reply : “ Brothers and fathers , listen to me . Our glorious God appeared to our ancestor Abraham in Mesopotamia before he settled in Haran .
44007003	God told him , ‘ Leave your native land and your relatives , and come into the land that I will show you . ’
44007004	So Abraham left the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Haran until his father died . Then God brought him here to the land where you now live .
44007005	“ But God gave him no inheritance here , not even one square foot of land . God did promise , however , that eventually the whole land would belong to Abraham and his descendantseven though he had no children yet .
44007006	God also told him that his descendants would live in a foreign land , where they would be oppressed as slaves for 400 years .
44007007	‘ But I will punish the nation that enslaves them , ’ God said , ‘ and in the end they will come out and worship me here in this place . ’
44007008	“ God also gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision at that time . So when Abraham became the father of Isaac , he circumcised him on the eighth day . And the practice was continued when Isaac became the father of Jacob , and when Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs of the Israelite nation .
44007009	“ These patriarchs were jealous of their brother Joseph , and they sold him to be a slave in Egypt . But God was with him
44007010	and rescued him from all his troubles . And God gave him favor before Pharaoh , king of Egypt . God also gave Joseph unusual wisdom , so that Pharaoh appointed him governor over all of Egypt and put him in charge of the palace .
44007011	“ But a famine came upon Egypt and Canaan . There was great misery , and our ancestors ran out of food .
44007012	Jacob heard that there was still grain in Egypt , so he sent his sonsour ancestorsto buy some .
44007013	The second time they went , Joseph revealed his identity to his brothers , and they were introduced to Pharaoh .
44007014	Then Joseph sent for his father , Jacob , and all his relatives to come to Egypt , seventy-five persons in all .
44007015	So Jacob went to Egypt . He died there , as did our ancestors .
44007016	Their bodies were taken to Shechem and buried in the tomb Abraham had bought for a certain price from Hamor’s sons in Shechem .
44007017	“ As the time drew near when God would fulfill his promise to Abraham , the number of our people in Egypt greatly increased .
44007018	But then a new king came to the throne of Egypt who knew nothing about Joseph .
44007019	This king exploited our people and oppressed them , forcing parents to abandon their newborn babies so they would die .
44007020	“ At that time Moses was borna beautiful child in God’s eyes . His parents cared for him at home for three months .
44007021	When they had to abandon him , Pharaoh’s daughter adopted him and raised him as her own son .
44007022	Moses was taught all the wisdom of the Egyptians , and he was powerful in both speech and action .
44007023	“ One day when Moses was forty years old , he decided to visit his relatives , the people of Israel .
44007024	He saw an Egyptian mistreating an Israelite . So Moses came to the man’s defense and avenged him , killing the Egyptian .
44007025	Moses assumed his fellow Israelites would realize that God had sent him to rescue them , but they didn’t .
44007026	“ The next day he visited them again and saw two men of Israel fighting . He tried to be a peacemaker . ‘ Men , ’ he said , ‘ you are brothers . Why are you fighting each other ? ’
44007027	“ But the man in the wrong pushed Moses aside . ‘ Who made you a ruler and judge over us ? ’ he asked .
44007028	‘ Are you going to kill me as you killed that Egyptian yesterday ? ’
44007029	When Moses heard that , he fled the country and lived as a foreigner in the land of Midian . There his two sons were born .
44007030	“ Forty years later , in the desert near Mount Sinai , an angel appeared to Moses in the flame of a burning bush .
44007031	When Moses saw it , he was amazed at the sight . As he went to take a closer look , the voice of the L ord called out to him ,
44007032	‘ I am the God of your ancestorsthe God of Abraham , Isaac , and Jacob . ’ Moses shook with terror and did not dare to look .
44007033	“ Then the L ord said to him , ‘ Take off your sandals , for you are standing on holy ground .
44007034	I have certainly seen the oppression of my people in Egypt . I have heard their groans and have come down to rescue them . Now go , for I am sending you back to Egypt . ’
44007035	“ So God sent back the same man his people had previously rejected when they demanded , ‘ Who made you a ruler and judge over us ? ’ Through the angel who appeared to him in the burning bush , God sent Moses to be their ruler and savior .
44007036	And by means of many wonders and miraculous signs , he led them out of Egypt , through the Red Sea , and through the wilderness for forty years .
44007037	“ Moses himself told the people of Israel , ‘ God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from among your own people . ’
44007038	Moses was with our ancestors , the assembly of God’s people in the wilderness , when the angel spoke to him at Mount Sinai . And there Moses received life-giving words to pass on to us .
44007039	“ But our ancestors refused to listen to Moses . They rejected him and wanted to return to Egypt .
44007040	They told Aaron , ‘ Make us some gods who can lead us , for we don’t know what has become of this Moses , who brought us out of Egypt . ’
44007041	So they made an idol shaped like a calf , and they sacrificed to it and celebrated over this thing they had made .
44007042	Then God turned away from them and abandoned them to serve the stars of heaven as their gods ! In the book of the prophets it is written , ‘ Was it to me you were bringing sacrifices and offerings during those forty years in the wilderness , Israel ?
44007043	No , you carried your pagan gods the shrine of Molech , the star of your god Rephan , and the images you made to worship them . So I will send you into exile as far away as Babylon . ’
44007044	“ Our ancestors carried the Tabernacle with them through the wilderness . It was constructed according to the plan God had shown to Moses .
44007045	Years later , when Joshua led our ancestors in battle against the nations that God drove out of this land , the Tabernacle was taken with them into their new territory . And it stayed there until the time of King David .
44007046	“ David found favor with God and asked for the privilege of building a permanent Temple for the God of Jacob .
44007047	But it was Solomon who actually built it .
44007048	However , the Most High doesn’t live in temples made by human hands . As the prophet says ,
44007049	‘ Heaven is my throne , and the earth is my footstool . Could you build me a temple as good as that ? ’ asks the L ord . ‘ Could you build me such a resting place ?
44007050	Didn’t my hands make both heaven and earth ? ’
44007051	“ You stubborn people ! You are heathen at heart and deaf to the truth . Must you forever resist the Holy Spirit ? That’s what your ancestors did , and so do you !
44007052	Name one prophet your ancestors didn’t persecute ! They even killed the ones who predicted the coming of the Righteous Onethe Messiah whom you betrayed and murdered .
44007053	You deliberately disobeyed God’s law , even though you received it from the hands of angels . ”
44007054	The Jewish leaders were infuriated by Stephen’s accusation , and they shook their fists at him in rage .
44007055	But Stephen , full of the Holy Spirit , gazed steadily into heaven and saw the glory of God , and he saw Jesus standing in the place of honor at God’s right hand .
44007056	And he told them , “ Look , I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing in the place of honor at God’s right hand ! ”
44007057	Then they put their hands over their ears and began shouting . They rushed at him
44007058	and dragged him out of the city and began to stone him . His accusers took off their coats and laid them at the feet of a young man named Saul .
44007059	As they stoned him , Stephen prayed , “ Lord Jesus , receive my spirit . ”
44007060	He fell to his knees , shouting , “ Lord , don’t charge them with this sin ! ” And with that , he died .
44008001	Saul was one of the witnesses , and he agreed completely with the killing of Stephen . A great wave of persecution began that day , sweeping over the church in Jerusalem ; and all the believers except the apostles were scattered through the regions of Judea and Samaria .
44008002	( Some devout men came and buried Stephen with great mourning . )
44008003	But Saul was going everywhere to destroy the church . He went from house to house , dragging out both men and women to throw them into prison .
44008004	But the believers who were scattered preached the Good News about Jesus wherever they went .
44008005	Philip , for example , went to the city of Samaria and told the people there about the Messiah .
44008006	Crowds listened intently to Philip because they were eager to hear his message and see the miraculous signs he did .
44008007	Many evil spirits were cast out , screaming as they left their victims . And many who had been paralyzed or lame were healed .
44008008	So there was great joy in that city .
44008009	A man named Simon had been a sorcerer there for many years , amazing the people of Samaria and claiming to be someone great .
44008010	Everyone , from the least to the greatest , often spoke of him as “ the Great Onethe Power of God . ”
44008011	They listened closely to him because for a long time he had astounded them with his magic .
44008012	But now the people believed Philip’s message of Good News concerning the Kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ . As a result , many men and women were baptized .
44008013	Then Simon himself believed and was baptized . He began following Philip wherever he went , and he was amazed by the signs and great miracles Philip performed .
44008014	When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that the people of Samaria had accepted God’s message , they sent Peter and John there .
44008015	As soon as they arrived , they prayed for these new believers to receive the Holy Spirit .
44008016	The Holy Spirit had not yet come upon any of them , for they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44008017	Then Peter and John laid their hands upon these believers , and they received the Holy Spirit .
44008018	When Simon saw that the Spirit was given when the apostles laid their hands on people , he offered them money to buy this power .
44008019	“ Let me have this power , too , ” he exclaimed , “ so that when I lay my hands on people , they will receive the Holy Spirit ! ”
44008020	But Peter replied , “ May your money be destroyed with you for thinking God’s gift can be bought !
44008021	You can have no part in this , for your heart is not right with God .
44008022	Repent of your wickedness and pray to the Lord . Perhaps he will forgive your evil thoughts ,
44008023	for I can see that you are full of bitter jealousy and are held captive by sin . ”
44008024	“ Pray to the Lord for me , ” Simon exclaimed , “ that these terrible things you’ve said won’t happen to me ! ”
44008025	After testifying and preaching the word of the Lord in Samaria , Peter and John returned to Jerusalem . And they stopped in many Samaritan villages along the way to preach the Good News .
44008026	As for Philip , an angel of the Lord said to him , “ Go south down the desert road that runs from Jerusalem to Gaza . ”
44008027	So he started out , and he met the treasurer of Ethiopia , a eunuch of great authority under the Kandake , the queen of Ethiopia . The eunuch had gone to Jerusalem to worship ,
44008028	and he was now returning . Seated in his carriage , he was reading aloud from the book of the prophet Isaiah .
44008029	The Holy Spirit said to Philip , “ Go over and walk along beside the carriage . ”
44008030	Philip ran over and heard the man reading from the prophet Isaiah . Philip asked , “ Do you understand what you are reading ? ”
44008031	The man replied , “ How can I , unless someone instructs me ? ” And he urged Philip to come up into the carriage and sit with him .
44008032	The passage of Scripture he had been reading was this : “ He was led like a sheep to the slaughter . And as a lamb is silent before the shearers , he did not open his mouth .
44008033	He was humiliated and received no justice . Who can speak of his descendants ? For his life was taken from the earth . ”
44008034	The eunuch asked Philip , “ Tell me , was the prophet talking about himself or someone else ? ”
44008035	So beginning with this same Scripture , Philip told him the Good News about Jesus .
44008036	As they rode along , they came to some water , and the eunuch said , “ Look ! There’s some water ! Why can’t I be baptized ? ”
44008038	He ordered the carriage to stop , and they went down into the water , and Philip baptized him .
44008039	When they came up out of the water , the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away . The eunuch never saw him again but went on his way rejoicing .
44008040	Meanwhile , Philip found himself farther north at the town of Azotus . He preached the Good News there and in every town along the way until he came to Caesarea .
44009001	Meanwhile , Saul was uttering threats with every breath and was eager to kill the Lord’s followers . So he went to the high priest .
44009002	He requested letters addressed to the synagogues in Damascus , asking for their cooperation in the arrest of any followers of the Way he found there . He wanted to bring themboth men and women back to Jerusalem in chains .
44009003	As he was approaching Damascus on this mission , a light from heaven suddenly shone down around him .
44009004	He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him , “ Saul ! Saul ! Why are you persecuting me ? ”
44009005	“ Who are you , lord ? ” Saul asked . And the voice replied , “ I am Jesus , the one you are persecuting !
44009006	Now get up and go into the city , and you will be told what you must do . ”
44009007	The men with Saul stood speechless , for they heard the sound of someone’s voice but saw no one !
44009008	Saul picked himself up off the ground , but when he opened his eyes he was blind . So his companions led him by the hand to Damascus .
44009009	He remained there blind for three days and did not eat or drink .
44009010	Now there was a believer in Damascus named Ananias . The Lord spoke to him in a vision , calling , “ Ananias ! ” “ Yes , Lord ! ” he replied .
44009011	The Lord said , “ Go over to Straight Street , to the house of Judas . When you get there , ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul . He is praying to me right now .
44009012	I have shown him a vision of a man named Ananias coming in and laying hands on him so he can see again . ”
44009013	“ But Lord , ” exclaimed Ananias , “ I’ve heard many people talk about the terrible things this man has done to the believers in Jerusalem !
44009014	And he is authorized by the leading priests to arrest everyone who calls upon your name . ”
44009015	But the Lord said , “ Go , for Saul is my chosen instrument to take my message to the Gentiles and to kings , as well as to the people of Israel .
44009016	And I will show him how much he must suffer for my name’s sake . ”
44009017	So Ananias went and found Saul . He laid his hands on him and said , “ Brother Saul , the Lord Jesus , who appeared to you on the road , has sent me so that you might regain your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit . ”
44009018	Instantly something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes , and he regained his sight . Then he got up and was baptized .
44009019	Afterward he ate some food and regained his strength . Saul stayed with the believers in Damascus for a few days .
44009020	And immediately he began preaching about Jesus in the synagogues , saying , “ He is indeed the Son of God ! ”
44009021	All who heard him were amazed . “ Isn’t this the same man who caused such devastation among Jesus’ followers in Jerusalem ? ” they asked . “ And didn’t he come here to arrest them and take them in chains to the leading priests ? ”
44009022	Saul’s preaching became more and more powerful , and the Jews in Damascus couldn’t refute his proofs that Jesus was indeed the Messiah .
44009023	After a while some of the Jews plotted together to kill him .
44009024	They were watching for him day and night at the city gate so they could murder him , but Saul was told about their plot .
44009025	So during the night , some of the other believers lowered him in a large basket through an opening in the city wall .
44009026	When Saul arrived in Jerusalem , he tried to meet with the believers , but they were all afraid of him . They did not believe he had truly become a believer !
44009027	Then Barnabas brought him to the apostles and told them how Saul had seen the Lord on the way to Damascus and how the Lord had spoken to Saul . He also told them that Saul had preached boldly in the name of Jesus in Damascus .
44009028	So Saul stayed with the apostles and went all around Jerusalem with them , preaching boldly in the name of the Lord .
44009029	He debated with some Greek-speaking Jews , but they tried to murder him .
44009030	When the believers heard about this , they took him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus , his hometown .
44009031	The church then had peace throughout Judea , Galilee , and Samaria , and it became stronger as the believers lived in the fear of the Lord . And with the encouragement of the Holy Spirit , it also grew in numbers .
44009032	Meanwhile , Peter traveled from place to place , and he came down to visit the believers in the town of Lydda .
44009033	There he met a man named Aeneas , who had been paralyzed and bedridden for eight years .
44009034	Peter said to him , “ Aeneas , Jesus Christ heals you ! Get up , and roll up your sleeping mat ! ” And he was healed instantly .
44009035	Then the whole population of Lydda and Sharon saw Aeneas walking around , and they turned to the Lord .
44009036	There was a believer in Joppa named Tabitha ( which in Greek is Dorcas ) . She was always doing kind things for others and helping the poor .
44009037	About this time she became ill and died . Her body was washed for burial and laid in an upstairs room .
44009038	But the believers had heard that Peter was nearby at Lydda , so they sent two men to beg him , “ Please come as soon as possible ! ”
44009039	So Peter returned with them ; and as soon as he arrived , they took him to the upstairs room . The room was filled with widows who were weeping and showing him the coats and other clothes Dorcas had made for them .
44009040	But Peter asked them all to leave the room ; then he knelt and prayed . Turning to the body he said , “ Get up , Tabitha . ” And she opened her eyes ! When she saw Peter , she sat up !
44009041	He gave her his hand and helped her up . Then he called in the widows and all the believers , and he presented her to them alive .
44009042	The news spread through the whole town , and many believed in the Lord .
44009043	And Peter stayed a long time in Joppa , living with Simon , a tanner of hides .
44010001	In Caesarea there lived a Roman army officer named Cornelius , who was a captain of the Italian Regiment .
44010002	He was a devout , God-fearing man , as was everyone in his household . He gave generously to the poor and prayed regularly to God .
44010003	One afternoon about three o’clock , he had a vision in which he saw an angel of God coming toward him . “ Cornelius ! ” the angel said .
44010004	Cornelius stared at him in terror . “ What is it , sir ? ” he asked the angel . And the angel replied , “ Your prayers and gifts to the poor have been received by God as an offering !
44010005	Now send some men to Joppa , and summon a man named Simon Peter .
44010006	He is staying with Simon , a tanner who lives near the seashore . ”
44010007	As soon as the angel was gone , Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier , one of his personal attendants .
44010008	He told them what had happened and sent them off to Joppa .
44010009	The next day as Cornelius’s messengers were nearing the town , Peter went up on the flat roof to pray . It was about noon ,
44010010	and he was hungry . But while a meal was being prepared , he fell into a trance .
44010011	He saw the sky open , and something like a large sheet was let down by its four corners .
44010012	In the sheet were all sorts of animals , reptiles , and birds .
44010013	Then a voice said to him , “ Get up , Peter ; kill and eat them . ”
44010014	“ No , Lord , ” Peter declared . “ I have never eaten anything that our Jewish laws have declared impure and unclean . ”
44010015	But the voice spoke again : “ Do not call something unclean if God has made it clean . ”
44010016	The same vision was repeated three times . Then the sheet was suddenly pulled up to heaven .
44010017	Peter was very perplexed . What could the vision mean ? Just then the men sent by Cornelius found Simon’s house . Standing outside the gate ,
44010018	they asked if a man named Simon Peter was staying there .
44010019	Meanwhile , as Peter was puzzling over the vision , the Holy Spirit said to him , “ Three men have come looking for you .
44010020	Get up , go downstairs , and go with them without hesitation . Don’t worry , for I have sent them . ”
44010021	So Peter went down and said , “ I’m the man you are looking for . Why have you come ? ”
44010022	They said , “ We were sent by Cornelius , a Roman officer . He is a devout and God-fearing man , well respected by all the Jews . A holy angel instructed him to summon you to his house so that he can hear your message . ”
44010023	So Peter invited the men to stay for the night . The next day he went with them , accompanied by some of the brothers from Joppa .
44010024	They arrived in Caesarea the following day . Cornelius was waiting for them and had called together his relatives and close friends .
44010025	As Peter entered his home , Cornelius fell at his feet and worshiped him .
44010026	But Peter pulled him up and said , “ Stand up ! I’m a human being just like you ! ”
44010027	So they talked together and went inside , where many others were assembled .
44010028	Peter told them , “ You know it is against our laws for a Jewish man to enter a Gentile home like this or to associate with you . But God has shown me that I should no longer think of anyone as impure or unclean .
44010029	So I came without objection as soon as I was sent for . Now tell me why you sent for me . ”
44010030	Cornelius replied , “ Four days ago I was praying in my house about this same time , three o’clock in the afternoon . Suddenly , a man in dazzling clothes was standing in front of me .
44010031	He told me , ‘ Cornelius , your prayer has been heard , and your gifts to the poor have been noticed by God !
44010032	Now send messengers to Joppa , and summon a man named Simon Peter . He is staying in the home of Simon , a tanner who lives near the seashore . ’
44010033	So I sent for you at once , and it was good of you to come . Now we are all here , waiting before God to hear the message the Lord has given you . ”
44010034	Then Peter replied , “ I see very clearly that God shows no favoritism .
44010035	In every nation he accepts those who fear him and do what is right .
44010036	This is the message of Good News for the people of Israelthat there is peace with God through Jesus Christ , who is Lord of all .
44010037	You know what happened throughout Judea , beginning in Galilee , after John began preaching his message of baptism .
44010038	And you know that God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power . Then Jesus went around doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil , for God was with him .
44010039	“ And we apostles are witnesses of all he did throughout Judea and in Jerusalem . They put him to death by hanging him on a cross ,
44010040	but God raised him to life on the third day . Then God allowed him to appear ,
44010041	not to the general public , but to us whom God had chosen in advance to be his witnesses . We were those who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead .
44010042	And he ordered us to preach everywhere and to testify that Jesus is the one appointed by God to be the judge of allthe living and the dead .
44010043	He is the one all the prophets testified about , saying that everyone who believes in him will have their sins forgiven through his name . ”
44010044	Even as Peter was saying these things , the Holy Spirit fell upon all who were listening to the message .
44010045	The Jewish believers who came with Peter were amazed that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out on the Gentiles , too .
44010046	For they heard them speaking in other tongues and praising God . Then Peter asked ,
44010047	“ Can anyone object to their being baptized , now that they have received the Holy Spirit just as we did ? ”
44010048	So he gave orders for them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ . Afterward Cornelius asked him to stay with them for several days .
44011001	Soon the news reached the apostles and other believers in Judea that the Gentiles had received the word of God .
44011002	But when Peter arrived back in Jerusalem , the Jewish believers criticized him .
44011003	“ You entered the home of Gentiles and even ate with them ! ” they said .
44011004	Then Peter told them exactly what had happened .
44011005	“ I was in the town of Joppa , ” he said , “ and while I was praying , I went into a trance and saw a vision . Something like a large sheet was let down by its four corners from the sky . And it came right down to me .
44011006	When I looked inside the sheet , I saw all sorts of tame and wild animals , reptiles , and birds .
44011007	And I heard a voice say , ‘ Get up , Peter ; kill and eat them . ’
44011008	“ ‘ No , Lord , ’ I replied . ‘ I have never eaten anything that our Jewish laws have declared impure or unclean . ’
44011009	“ But the voice from heaven spoke again : ‘ Do not call something unclean if God has made it clean . ’
44011010	This happened three times before the sheet and all it contained was pulled back up to heaven .
44011011	“ Just then three men who had been sent from Caesarea arrived at the house where we were staying .
44011012	The Holy Spirit told me to go with them and not to worry that they were Gentiles . These six brothers here accompanied me , and we soon entered the home of the man who had sent for us .
44011013	He told us how an angel had appeared to him in his home and had told him , ‘ Send messengers to Joppa , and summon a man named Simon Peter .
44011014	He will tell you how you and everyone in your household can be saved ! ’
44011015	“ As I began to speak , ” Peter continued , “ the Holy Spirit fell on them , just as he fell on us at the beginning .
44011016	Then I thought of the Lord’s words when he said , ‘ John baptized with water , but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit . ’
44011017	And since God gave these Gentiles the same gift he gave us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ , who was I to stand in God’s way ? ”
44011018	When the others heard this , they stopped objecting and began praising God . They said , “ We can see that God has also given the Gentiles the privilege of repenting of their sins and receiving eternal life . ”
44011019	Meanwhile , the believers who had been scattered during the persecution after Stephen’s death traveled as far as Phoenicia , Cyprus , and Antioch of Syria . They preached the word of God , but only to Jews .
44011020	However , some of the believers who went to Antioch from Cyprus and Cyrene began preaching to the Gentiles about the Lord Jesus .
44011021	The power of the Lord was with them , and a large number of these Gentiles believed and turned to the Lord .
44011022	When the church at Jerusalem heard what had happened , they sent Barnabas to Antioch .
44011023	When he arrived and saw this evidence of God’s blessing , he was filled with joy , and he encouraged the believers to stay true to the Lord .
44011024	Barnabas was a good man , full of the Holy Spirit and strong in faith . And many people were brought to the Lord .
44011025	Then Barnabas went on to Tarsus to look for Saul .
44011026	When he found him , he brought him back to Antioch . Both of them stayed there with the church for a full year , teaching large crowds of people . ( It was at Antioch that the believers were first called Christians . )
44011027	During this time some prophets traveled from Jerusalem to Antioch .
44011028	One of them named Agabus stood up in one of the meetings and predicted by the Spirit that a great famine was coming upon the entire Roman world . ( This was fulfilled during the reign of Claudius . )
44011029	So the believers in Antioch decided to send relief to the brothers and sisters in Judea , everyone giving as much as they could .
44011030	This they did , entrusting their gifts to Barnabas and Saul to take to the elders of the church in Jerusalem .
44012001	About that time King Herod Agrippa began to persecute some believers in the church .
44012002	He had the apostle James ( John’s brother ) killed with a sword .
44012003	When Herod saw how much this pleased the Jewish people , he also arrested Peter . ( This took place during the Passover celebration . )
44012004	Then he imprisoned him , placing him under the guard of four squads of four soldiers each . Herod intended to bring Peter out for public trial after the Passover .
44012005	But while Peter was in prison , the church prayed very earnestly for him .
44012006	The night before Peter was to be placed on trial , he was asleep , fastened with two chains between two soldiers . Others stood guard at the prison gate .
44012007	Suddenly , there was a bright light in the cell , and an angel of the Lord stood before Peter . The angel struck him on the side to awaken him and said , “ Quick ! Get up ! ” And the chains fell off his wrists .
44012008	Then the angel told him , “ Get dressed and put on your sandals . ” And he did . “ Now put on your coat and follow me , ” the angel ordered .
44012009	So Peter left the cell , following the angel . But all the time he thought it was a vision . He didn’t realize it was actually happening .
44012010	They passed the first and second guard posts and came to the iron gate leading to the city , and this opened for them all by itself . So they passed through and started walking down the street , and then the angel suddenly left him .
44012011	Peter finally came to his senses . “ It’s really true ! ” he said . “ The Lord has sent his angel and saved me from Herod and from what the Jewish leaders had planned to do to me ! ”
44012012	When he realized this , he went to the home of Mary , the mother of John Mark , where many were gathered for prayer .
44012013	He knocked at the door in the gate , and a servant girl named Rhoda came to open it .
44012014	When she recognized Peter’s voice , she was so overjoyed that , instead of opening the door , she ran back inside and told everyone , “ Peter is standing at the door ! ”
44012015	“ You’re out of your mind ! ” they said . When she insisted , they decided , “ It must be his angel . ”
44012016	Meanwhile , Peter continued knocking . When they finally opened the door and saw him , they were amazed .
44012017	He motioned for them to quiet down and told them how the Lord had led him out of prison . “ Tell James and the other brothers what happened , ” he said . And then he went to another place .
44012018	At dawn there was a great commotion among the soldiers about what had happened to Peter .
44012019	Herod Agrippa ordered a thorough search for him . When he couldn’t be found , Herod interrogated the guards and sentenced them to death . Afterward Herod left Judea to stay in Caesarea for a while .
44012020	Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon . So they sent a delegation to make peace with him because their cities were dependent upon Herod’s country for food . The delegates won the support of Blastus , Herod’s personal assistant ,
44012021	and an appointment with Herod was granted . When the day arrived , Herod put on his royal robes , sat on his throne , and made a speech to them .
44012022	The people gave him a great ovation , shouting , “ It’s the voice of a god , not of a man ! ”
44012023	Instantly , an angel of the Lord struck Herod with a sickness , because he accepted the people’s worship instead of giving the glory to God . So he was consumed with worms and died .
44012024	Meanwhile , the word of God continued to spread , and there were many new believers .
44012025	When Barnabas and Saul had finished their mission to Jerusalem , they returned , taking John Mark with them .
44013001	Among the prophets and teachers of the church at Antioch of Syria were Barnabas , Simeon ( called “ the black man ” ) , Lucius ( from Cyrene ) , Manaen ( the childhood companion of King Herod Antipas ) , and Saul .
44013002	One day as these men were worshiping the Lord and fasting , the Holy Spirit said , “ Dedicate Barnabas and Saul for the special work to which I have called them . ”
44013003	So after more fasting and prayer , the men laid their hands on them and sent them on their way .
44013004	So Barnabas and Saul were sent out by the Holy Spirit . They went down to the seaport of Seleucia and then sailed for the island of Cyprus .
44013005	There , in the town of Salamis , they went to the Jewish synagogues and preached the word of God . John Mark went with them as their assistant .
44013006	Afterward they traveled from town to town across the entire island until finally they reached Paphos , where they met a Jewish sorcerer , a false prophet named Bar-Jesus .
44013007	He had attached himself to the governor , Sergius Paulus , who was an intelligent man . The governor invited Barnabas and Saul to visit him , for he wanted to hear the word of God .
44013008	But Elymas , the sorcerer ( as his name means in Greek ) , interfered and urged the governor to pay no attention to what Barnabas and Saul said . He was trying to keep the governor from believing .
44013009	Saul , also known as Paul , was filled with the Holy Spirit , and he looked the sorcerer in the eye .
44013010	Then he said , “ You son of the devil , full of every sort of deceit and fraud , and enemy of all that is good ! Will you never stop perverting the true ways of the Lord ?
44013011	Watch now , for the Lord has laid his hand of punishment upon you , and you will be struck blind . You will not see the sunlight for some time . ” Instantly mist and darkness came over the man’s eyes , and he began groping around begging for someone to take his hand and lead him .
44013012	When the governor saw what had happened , he became a believer , for he was astonished at the teaching about the Lord .
44013013	Paul and his companions then left Paphos by ship for Pamphylia , landing at the port town of Perga . There John Mark left them and returned to Jerusalem .
44013014	But Paul and Barnabas traveled inland to Antioch of Pisidia . On the Sabbath they went to the synagogue for the services .
44013015	After the usual readings from the books of Moses and the prophets , those in charge of the service sent them this message : “ Brothers , if you have any word of encouragement for the people , come and give it . ”
44013016	So Paul stood , lifted his hand to quiet them , and started speaking . “ Men of Israel , ” he said , “ and you God-fearing Gentiles , listen to me .
44013017	“ The God of this nation of Israel chose our ancestors and made them multiply and grow strong during their stay in Egypt . Then with a powerful arm he led them out of their slavery .
44013018	He put up with them through forty years of wandering in the wilderness .
44013019	Then he destroyed seven nations in Canaan and gave their land to Israel as an inheritance .
44013020	All this took about 450 years . “ After that , God gave them judges to rule until the time of Samuel the prophet .
44013021	Then the people begged for a king , and God gave them Saul son of Kish , a man of the tribe of Benjamin , who reigned for forty years .
44013022	But God removed Saul and replaced him with David , a man about whom God said , ‘ I have found David son of Jesse , a man after my own heart . He will do everything I want him to do . ’
44013023	“ And it is one of King David’s descendants , Jesus , who is God’s promised Savior of Israel !
44013024	Before he came , John the Baptist preached that all the people of Israel needed to repent of their sins and turn to God and be baptized .
44013025	As John was finishing his ministry he asked , ‘ Do you think I am the Messiah ? No , I am not ! But he is coming soonand I’m not even worthy to be his slave and untie the sandals on his feet . ’
44013026	“ Brothersyou sons of Abraham , and also you God-fearing Gentilesthis message of salvation has been sent to us !
44013027	The people in Jerusalem and their leaders did not recognize Jesus as the one the prophets had spoken about . Instead , they condemned him , and in doing this they fulfilled the prophets’ words that are read every Sabbath .
44013028	They found no legal reason to execute him , but they asked Pilate to have him killed anyway .
44013029	“ When they had done all that the prophecies said about him , they took him down from the cross and placed him in a tomb .
44013030	But God raised him from the dead !
44013031	And over a period of many days he appeared to those who had gone with him from Galilee to Jerusalem . They are now his witnesses to the people of Israel .
44013032	“ And now we are here to bring you this Good News . The promise was made to our ancestors ,
44013033	and God has now fulfilled it for us , their descendants , by raising Jesus . This is what the second psalm says about Jesus : ‘ You are my Son . Today I have become your Father . ’
44013034	For God had promised to raise him from the dead , not leaving him to rot in the grave . He said , ‘ I will give you the sacred blessings I promised to David . ’
44013035	Another psalm explains it more fully : ‘ You will not allow your Holy One to rot in the grave . ’
44013036	This is not a reference to David , for after David had done the will of God in his own generation , he died and was buried with his ancestors , and his body decayed .
44013037	No , it was a reference to someone elsesomeone whom God raised and whose body did not decay .
44013038	“ Brothers , listen ! We are here to proclaim that through this man Jesus there is forgiveness for your sins .
44013039	Everyone who believes in him is declared right with Godsomething the law of Moses could never do .
44013040	Be careful ! Don’t let the prophets’ words apply to you . For they said ,
44013041	‘ Look , you mockers , be amazed and die ! For I am doing something in your own day , something you wouldn’t believe even if someone told you about it . ’ ”
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas left the synagogue that day , the people begged them to speak about these things again the next week .
44013043	Many Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas , and the two men urged them to continue to rely on the grace of God .
44013044	The following week almost the entire city turned out to hear them preach the word of the Lord .
44013045	But when some of the Jews saw the crowds , they were jealous ; so they slandered Paul and argued against whatever he said .
44013046	Then Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly and declared , “ It was necessary that we first preach the word of God to you Jews . But since you have rejected it and judged yourselves unworthy of eternal life , we will offer it to the Gentiles .
44013047	For the Lord gave us this command when he said , ‘ I have made you a light to the Gentiles , to bring salvation to the farthest corners of the earth . ’ ”
44013048	When the Gentiles heard this , they were very glad and thanked the Lord for his message ; and all who were chosen for eternal life became believers .
44013049	So the Lord’s message spread throughout that region .
44013050	Then the Jews stirred up the influential religious women and the leaders of the city , and they incited a mob against Paul and Barnabas and ran them out of town .
44013051	So they shook the dust from their feet as a sign of rejection and went to the town of Iconium .
44013052	And the believers were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit .
44014001	The same thing happened in Iconium . Paul and Barnabas went to the Jewish synagogue and preached with such power that a great number of both Jews and Greeks became believers .
44014002	Some of the Jews , however , spurned God’s message and poisoned the minds of the Gentiles against Paul and Barnabas .
44014003	But the apostles stayed there a long time , preaching boldly about the grace of the Lord . And the Lord proved their message was true by giving them power to do miraculous signs and wonders .
44014004	But the people of the town were divided in their opinion about them . Some sided with the Jews , and some with the apostles .
44014005	Then a mob of Gentiles and Jews , along with their leaders , decided to attack and stone them .
44014006	When the apostles learned of it , they fled to the region of Lycaoniato the towns of Lystra and Derbe and the surrounding area .
44014007	And there they preached the Good News .
44014008	While they were at Lystra , Paul and Barnabas came upon a man with crippled feet . He had been that way from birth , so he had never walked . He was sitting
44014009	and listening as Paul preached . Looking straight at him , Paul realized he had faith to be healed .
44014010	So Paul called to him in a loud voice , “ Stand up ! ” And the man jumped to his feet and started walking .
44014011	When the crowd saw what Paul had done , they shouted in their local dialect , “ These men are gods in human form ! ”
44014012	They decided that Barnabas was the Greek god Zeus and that Paul was Hermes , since he was the chief speaker .
44014013	Now the temple of Zeus was located just outside the town . So the priest of the temple and the crowd brought bulls and wreaths of flowers to the town gates , and they prepared to offer sacrifices to the apostles .
44014014	But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard what was happening , they tore their clothing in dismay and ran out among the people , shouting ,
44014015	“ Friends , why are you doing this ? We are merely human beingsjust like you ! We have come to bring you the Good News that you should turn from these worthless things and turn to the living God , who made heaven and earth , the sea , and everything in them .
44014016	In the past he permitted all the nations to go their own ways ,
44014017	but he never left them without evidence of himself and his goodness . For instance , he sends you rain and good crops and gives you food and joyful hearts . ”
44014018	But even with these words , Paul and Barnabas could scarcely restrain the people from sacrificing to them .
44014019	Then some Jews arrived from Antioch and Iconium and won the crowds to their side . They stoned Paul and dragged him out of town , thinking he was dead .
44014020	But as the believers gathered around him , he got up and went back into the town . The next day he left with Barnabas for Derbe .
44014021	After preaching the Good News in Derbe and making many disciples , Paul and Barnabas returned to Lystra , Iconium , and Antioch of Pisidia ,
44014022	where they strengthened the believers . They encouraged them to continue in the faith , reminding them that we must suffer many hardships to enter the Kingdom of God .
44014023	Paul and Barnabas also appointed elders in every church . With prayer and fasting , they turned the elders over to the care of the Lord , in whom they had put their trust .
44014024	Then they traveled back through Pisidia to Pamphylia .
44014025	They preached the word in Perga , then went down to Attalia .
44014026	Finally , they returned by ship to Antioch of Syria , where their journey had begun . The believers there had entrusted them to the grace of God to do the work they had now completed .
44014027	Upon arriving in Antioch , they called the church together and reported everything God had done through them and how he had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles , too .
44014028	And they stayed there with the believers for a long time .
44015001	While Paul and Barnabas were at Antioch of Syria , some men from Judea arrived and began to teach the believers : “ Unless you are circumcised as required by the law of Moses , you cannot be saved . ”
44015002	Paul and Barnabas disagreed with them , arguing vehemently . Finally , the church decided to send Paul and Barnabas to Jerusalem , accompanied by some local believers , to talk to the apostles and elders about this question .
44015003	The church sent the delegates to Jerusalem , and they stopped along the way in Phoenicia and Samaria to visit the believers . They told themmuch to everyone’s joythat the Gentiles , too , were being converted .
44015004	When they arrived in Jerusalem , Barnabas and Paul were welcomed by the whole church , including the apostles and elders . They reported everything God had done through them .
44015005	But then some of the believers who belonged to the sect of the Pharisees stood up and insisted , “ The Gentile converts must be circumcised and required to follow the law of Moses . ”
44015006	So the apostles and elders met together to resolve this issue .
44015007	At the meeting , after a long discussion , Peter stood and addressed them as follows : “ Brothers , you all know that God chose me from among you some time ago to preach to the Gentiles so that they could hear the Good News and believe .
44015008	God knows people’s hearts , and he confirmed that he accepts Gentiles by giving them the Holy Spirit , just as he did to us .
44015009	He made no distinction between us and them , for he cleansed their hearts through faith .
44015010	So why are you now challenging God by burdening the Gentile believers with a yoke that neither we nor our ancestors were able to bear ?
44015011	We believe that we are all saved the same way , by the undeserved grace of the Lord Jesus . ”
44015012	Everyone listened quietly as Barnabas and Paul told about the miraculous signs and wonders God had done through them among the Gentiles .
44015013	When they had finished , James stood and said , “ Brothers , listen to me .
44015014	Peter has told you about the time God first visited the Gentiles to take from them a people for himself .
44015015	And this conversion of Gentiles is exactly what the prophets predicted . As it is written :
44015016	‘ Afterward I will return and restore the fallen house of David . I will rebuild its ruins and restore it ,
44015017	so that the rest of humanity might seek the L ord , including the Gentiles all those I have called to be mine . The L ord has spoken
44015018	he who made these things known so long ago . ’
44015019	“ And so my judgment is that we should not make it difficult for the Gentiles who are turning to God .
44015020	Instead , we should write and tell them to abstain from eating food offered to idols , from sexual immorality , from eating the meat of strangled animals , and from consuming blood .
44015021	For these laws of Moses have been preached in Jewish synagogues in every city on every Sabbath for many generations . ”
44015022	Then the apostles and elders together with the whole church in Jerusalem chose delegates , and they sent them to Antioch of Syria with Paul and Barnabas to report on this decision . The men chosen were two of the church leaders Judas ( also called Barsabbas ) and Silas .
44015023	This is the letter they took with them : “ This letter is from the apostles and elders , your brothers in Jerusalem . It is written to the Gentile believers in Antioch , Syria , and Cilicia . Greetings !
44015024	“ We understand that some men from here have troubled you and upset you with their teaching , but we did not send them !
44015025	So we decided , having come to complete agreement , to send you official representatives , along with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
44015026	who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
44015027	We are sending Judas and Silas to confirm what we have decided concerning your question .
44015028	“ For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us to lay no greater burden on you than these few requirements :
44015029	You must abstain from eating food offered to idols , from consuming blood or the meat of strangled animals , and from sexual immorality . If you do this , you will do well . Farewell . ”
44015030	The messengers went at once to Antioch , where they called a general meeting of the believers and delivered the letter .
44015031	And there was great joy throughout the church that day as they read this encouraging message .
44015032	Then Judas and Silas , both being prophets , spoke at length to the believers , encouraging and strengthening their faith .
44015033	They stayed for a while , and then the believers sent them back to the church in Jerusalem with a blessing of peace .
44015035	Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch . They and many others taught and preached the word of the Lord there .
44015036	After some time Paul said to Barnabas , “ Let’s go back and visit each city where we previously preached the word of the Lord , to see how the new believers are doing . ”
44015037	Barnabas agreed and wanted to take along John Mark .
44015038	But Paul disagreed strongly , since John Mark had deserted them in Pamphylia and had not continued with them in their work .
44015039	Their disagreement was so sharp that they separated . Barnabas took John Mark with him and sailed for Cyprus .
44015040	Paul chose Silas , and as he left , the believers entrusted him to the Lord’s gracious care .
44015041	Then he traveled throughout Syria and Cilicia , strengthening the churches there .
44016001	Paul went first to Derbe and then to Lystra , where there was a young disciple named Timothy . His mother was a Jewish believer , but his father was a Greek .
44016002	Timothy was well thought of by the believers in Lystra and Iconium ,
44016003	so Paul wanted him to join them on their journey . In deference to the Jews of the area , he arranged for Timothy to be circumcised before they left , for everyone knew that his father was a Greek .
44016004	Then they went from town to town , instructing the believers to follow the decisions made by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem .
44016005	So the churches were strengthened in their faith and grew larger every day .
44016006	Next Paul and Silas traveled through the area of Phrygia and Galatia , because the Holy Spirit had prevented them from preaching the word in the province of Asia at that time .
44016007	Then coming to the borders of Mysia , they headed north for the province of Bithynia , but again the Spirit of Jesus did not allow them to go there .
44016008	So instead , they went on through Mysia to the seaport of Troas .
44016009	That night Paul had a vision : A man from Macedonia in northern Greece was standing there , pleading with him , “ Come over to Macedonia and help us ! ”
44016010	So we decided to leave for Macedonia at once , having concluded that God was calling us to preach the Good News there .
44016011	We boarded a boat at Troas and sailed straight across to the island of Samothrace , and the next day we landed at Neapolis .
44016012	From there we reached Philippi , a major city of that district of Macedonia and a Roman colony . And we stayed there several days .
44016013	On the Sabbath we went a little way outside the city to a riverbank , where we thought people would be meeting for prayer , and we sat down to speak with some women who had gathered there .
44016014	One of them was Lydia from Thyatira , a merchant of expensive purple cloth , who worshiped God . As she listened to us , the Lord opened her heart , and she accepted what Paul was saying .
44016015	She was baptized along with other members of her household , and she asked us to be her guests . “ If you agree that I am a true believer in the Lord , ” she said , “ come and stay at my home . ” And she urged us until we agreed .
44016016	One day as we were going down to the place of prayer , we met a demon-possessed slave girl . She was a fortune-teller who earned a lot of money for her masters .
44016017	She followed Paul and the rest of us , shouting , “ These men are servants of the Most High God , and they have come to tell you how to be saved . ”
44016018	This went on day after day until Paul got so exasperated that he turned and said to the demon within her , “ I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . ” And instantly it left her .
44016019	Her masters’ hopes of wealth were now shattered , so they grabbed Paul and Silas and dragged them before the authorities at the marketplace .
44016020	“ The whole city is in an uproar because of these Jews ! ” they shouted to the city officials .
44016021	“ They are teaching customs that are illegal for us Romans to practice . ”
44016022	A mob quickly formed against Paul and Silas , and the city officials ordered them stripped and beaten with wooden rods .
44016023	They were severely beaten , and then they were thrown into prison . The jailer was ordered to make sure they didn’t escape .
44016024	So the jailer put them into the inner dungeon and clamped their feet in the stocks .
44016025	Around midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God , and the other prisoners were listening .
44016026	Suddenly , there was a massive earthquake , and the prison was shaken to its foundations . All the doors immediately flew open , and the chains of every prisoner fell off !
44016027	The jailer woke up to see the prison doors wide open . He assumed the prisoners had escaped , so he drew his sword to kill himself .
44016028	But Paul shouted to him , “ Stop ! Don’t kill yourself ! We are all here ! ”
44016029	The jailer called for lights and ran to the dungeon and fell down trembling before Paul and Silas .
44016030	Then he brought them out and asked , “ Sirs , what must I do to be saved ? ”
44016031	They replied , “ Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved , along with everyone in your household . ”
44016032	And they shared the word of the Lord with him and with all who lived in his household .
44016033	Even at that hour of the night , the jailer cared for them and washed their wounds . Then he and everyone in his household were immediately baptized .
44016034	He brought them into his house and set a meal before them , and he and his entire household rejoiced because they all believed in God .
44016035	The next morning the city officials sent the police to tell the jailer , “ Let those men go ! ”
44016036	So the jailer told Paul , “ The city officials have said you and Silas are free to leave . Go in peace . ”
44016037	But Paul replied , “ They have publicly beaten us without a trial and put us in prisonand we are Roman citizens . So now they want us to leave secretly ? Certainly not ! Let them come themselves to release us ! ”
44016038	When the police reported this , the city officials were alarmed to learn that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens .
44016039	So they came to the jail and apologized to them . Then they brought them out and begged them to leave the city .
44016040	When Paul and Silas left the prison , they returned to the home of Lydia . There they met with the believers and encouraged them once more . Then they left town .
44017001	Paul and Silas then traveled through the towns of Amphipolis and Apollonia and came to Thessalonica , where there was a Jewish synagogue .
44017002	As was Paul’s custom , he went to the synagogue service , and for three Sabbaths in a row he used the Scriptures to reason with the people .
44017003	He explained the prophecies and proved that the Messiah must suffer and rise from the dead . He said , “ This Jesus I’m telling you about is the Messiah . ”
44017004	Some of the Jews who listened were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas , along with many God-fearing Greek men and quite a few prominent women .
44017005	But some of the Jews were jealous , so they gathered some troublemakers from the marketplace to form a mob and start a riot . They attacked the home of Jason , searching for Paul and Silas so they could drag them out to the crowd .
44017006	Not finding them there , they dragged out Jason and some of the other believers instead and took them before the city council . “ Paul and Silas have caused trouble all over the world , ” they shouted , “ and now they are here disturbing our city , too .
44017007	And Jason has welcomed them into his home . They are all guilty of treason against Caesar , for they profess allegiance to another king , named Jesus . ”
44017008	The people of the city , as well as the city council , were thrown into turmoil by these reports .
44017009	So the officials forced Jason and the other believers to post bond , and then they released them .
44017010	That very night the believers sent Paul and Silas to Berea . When they arrived there , they went to the Jewish synagogue .
44017011	And the people of Berea were more open-minded than those in Thessalonica , and they listened eagerly to Paul’s message . They searched the Scriptures day after day to see if Paul and Silas were teaching the truth .
44017012	As a result , many Jews believed , as did many of the prominent Greek women and men .
44017013	But when some Jews in Thessalonica learned that Paul was preaching the word of God in Berea , they went there and stirred up trouble .
44017014	The believers acted at once , sending Paul on to the coast , while Silas and Timothy remained behind .
44017015	Those escorting Paul went with him all the way to Athens ; then they returned to Berea with instructions for Silas and Timothy to hurry and join him .
44017016	While Paul was waiting for them in Athens , he was deeply troubled by all the idols he saw everywhere in the city .
44017017	He went to the synagogue to reason with the Jews and the God-fearing Gentiles , and he spoke daily in the public square to all who happened to be there .
44017018	He also had a debate with some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers . When he told them about Jesus and his resurrection , they said , “ What’s this babbler trying to say with these strange ideas he’s picked up ? ” Others said , “ He seems to be preaching about some foreign gods . ”
44017019	Then they took him to the high council of the city . “ Come and tell us about this new teaching , ” they said .
44017020	“ You are saying some rather strange things , and we want to know what it’s all about . ”
44017021	( It should be explained that all the Athenians as well as the foreigners in Athens seemed to spend all their time discussing the latest ideas . )
44017022	So Paul , standing before the council , addressed them as follows : “ Men of Athens , I notice that you are very religious in every way ,
44017023	for as I was walking along I saw your many shrines . And one of your altars had this inscription on it : ‘ To an Unknown God . ’ This God , whom you worship without knowing , is the one I’m telling you about .
44017024	“ He is the God who made the world and everything in it . Since he is Lord of heaven and earth , he doesn’t live in man-made temples ,
44017025	and human hands can’t serve his needsfor he has no needs . He himself gives life and breath to everything , and he satisfies every need .
44017026	From one man he created all the nations throughout the whole earth . He decided beforehand when they should rise and fall , and he determined their boundaries .
44017027	“ His purpose was for the nations to seek after God and perhaps feel their way toward him and find himthough he is not far from any one of us .
44017028	For in him we live and move and exist . As some of your own poets have said , ‘ We are his offspring . ’
44017029	And since this is true , we shouldn’t think of God as an idol designed by craftsmen from gold or silver or stone .
44017030	“ God overlooked people’s ignorance about these things in earlier times , but now he commands everyone everywhere to repent of their sins and turn to him .
44017031	For he has set a day for judging the world with justice by the man he has appointed , and he proved to everyone who this is by raising him from the dead . ”
44017032	When they heard Paul speak about the resurrection of the dead , some laughed in contempt , but others said , “ We want to hear more about this later . ”
44017033	That ended Paul’s discussion with them ,
44017034	but some joined him and became believers . Among them were Dionysius , a member of the council , a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	Then Paul left Athens and went to Corinth .
44018002	There he became acquainted with a Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , who had recently arrived from Italy with his wife , Priscilla . They had left Italy when Claudius Caesar deported all Jews from Rome .
44018003	Paul lived and worked with them , for they were tentmakers just as he was .
44018004	Each Sabbath found Paul at the synagogue , trying to convince the Jews and Greeks alike .
44018005	And after Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia , Paul spent all his time preaching the word . He testified to the Jews that Jesus was the Messiah .
44018006	But when they opposed and insulted him , Paul shook the dust from his clothes and said , “ Your blood is upon your own headsI am innocent . From now on I will go preach to the Gentiles . ”
44018007	Then he left and went to the home of Titius Justus , a Gentile who worshiped God and lived next door to the synagogue .
44018008	Crispus , the leader of the synagogue , and everyone in his household believed in the Lord . Many others in Corinth also heard Paul , became believers , and were baptized .
44018009	One night the Lord spoke to Paul in a vision and told him , “ Don’t be afraid ! Speak out ! Don’t be silent !
44018010	For I am with you , and no one will attack and harm you , for many people in this city belong to me . ”
44018011	So Paul stayed there for the next year and a half , teaching the word of God .
44018012	But when Gallio became governor of Achaia , some Jews rose up together against Paul and brought him before the governor for judgment .
44018013	They accused Paul of “ persuading people to worship God in ways that are contrary to our law . ”
44018014	But just as Paul started to make his defense , Gallio turned to Paul’s accusers and said , “ Listen , you Jews , if this were a case involving some wrongdoing or a serious crime , I would have a reason to accept your case .
44018015	But since it is merely a question of words and names and your Jewish law , take care of it yourselves . I refuse to judge such matters . ”
44018016	And he threw them out of the courtroom .
44018017	The crowd then grabbed Sosthenes , the leader of the synagogue , and beat him right there in the courtroom . But Gallio paid no attention .
44018018	Paul stayed in Corinth for some time after that , then said good-bye to the brothers and sisters and went to nearby Cenchrea . There he shaved his head according to Jewish custom , marking the end of a vow . Then he set sail for Syria , taking Priscilla and Aquila with him .
44018019	They stopped first at the port of Ephesus , where Paul left the others behind . While he was there , he went to the synagogue to reason with the Jews .
44018020	They asked him to stay longer , but he declined .
44018021	As he left , however , he said , “ I will come back later , God willing . ” Then he set sail from Ephesus .
44018022	The next stop was at the port of Caesarea . From there he went up and visited the church at Jerusalem and then went back to Antioch .
44018023	After spending some time in Antioch , Paul went back through Galatia and Phrygia , visiting and strengthening all the believers .
44018024	Meanwhile , a Jew named Apollos , an eloquent speaker who knew the Scriptures well , had arrived in Ephesus from Alexandria in Egypt .
44018025	He had been taught the way of the Lord , and he taught others about Jesus with an enthusiastic spirit and with accuracy . However , he knew only about John’s baptism .
44018026	When Priscilla and Aquila heard him preaching boldly in the synagogue , they took him aside and explained the way of God even more accurately .
44018027	Apollos had been thinking about going to Achaia , and the brothers and sisters in Ephesus encouraged him to go . They wrote to the believers in Achaia , asking them to welcome him . When he arrived there , he proved to be of great benefit to those who , by God’s grace , had believed .
44018028	He refuted the Jews with powerful arguments in public debate . Using the Scriptures , he explained to them that Jesus was the Messiah .
44019001	While Apollos was in Corinth , Paul traveled through the interior regions until he reached Ephesus , on the coast , where he found several believers .
44019002	“ Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed ? ” he asked them . “ No , ” they replied , “ we haven’t even heard that there is a Holy Spirit . ”
44019003	“ Then what baptism did you experience ? ” he asked . And they replied , “ The baptism of John . ”
44019004	Paul said , “ John’s baptism called for repentance from sin . But John himself told the people to believe in the one who would come later , meaning Jesus . ”
44019005	As soon as they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	Then when Paul laid his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came on them , and they spoke in other tongues and prophesied .
44019007	There were about twelve men in all .
44019008	Then Paul went to the synagogue and preached boldly for the next three months , arguing persuasively about the Kingdom of God .
44019009	But some became stubborn , rejecting his message and publicly speaking against the Way . So Paul left the synagogue and took the believers with him . Then he held daily discussions at the lecture hall of Tyrannus .
44019010	This went on for the next two years , so that people throughout the province of Asiaboth Jews and Greeksheard the word of the Lord .
44019011	God gave Paul the power to perform unusual miracles .
44019012	When handkerchiefs or aprons that had merely touched his skin were placed on sick people , they were healed of their diseases , and evil spirits were expelled .
44019013	A group of Jews was traveling from town to town casting out evil spirits . They tried to use the name of the Lord Jesus in their incantation , saying , “ I command you in the name of Jesus , whom Paul preaches , to come out ! ”
44019014	Seven sons of Sceva , a leading priest , were doing this .
44019015	But one time when they tried it , the evil spirit replied , “ I know Jesus , and I know Paul , but who are you ? ”
44019016	Then the man with the evil spirit leaped on them , overpowered them , and attacked them with such violence that they fled from the house , naked and battered .
44019017	The story of what happened spread quickly all through Ephesus , to Jews and Greeks alike . A solemn fear descended on the city , and the name of the Lord Jesus was greatly honored .
44019018	Many who became believers confessed their sinful practices .
44019019	A number of them who had been practicing sorcery brought their incantation books and burned them at a public bonfire . The value of the books was several million dollars .
44019020	So the message about the Lord spread widely and had a powerful effect .
44019021	Afterward Paul felt compelled by the Spirit to go over to Macedonia and Achaia before going to Jerusalem . “ And after that , ” he said , “ I must go on to Rome ! ”
44019022	He sent his two assistants , Timothy and Erastus , ahead to Macedonia while he stayed awhile longer in the province of Asia .
44019023	About that time , serious trouble developed in Ephesus concerning the Way .
44019024	It began with Demetrius , a silversmith who had a large business manufacturing silver shrines of the Greek goddess Artemis . He kept many craftsmen busy .
44019025	He called them together , along with others employed in similar trades , and addressed them as follows : “ Gentlemen , you know that our wealth comes from this business .
44019026	But as you have seen and heard , this man Paul has persuaded many people that handmade gods aren’t really gods at all . And he’s done this not only here in Ephesus but throughout the entire province !
44019027	Of course , I’m not just talking about the loss of public respect for our business . I’m also concerned that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will lose its influence and that Artemisthis magnificent goddess worshiped throughout the province of Asia and all around the world will be robbed of her great prestige ! ”
44019028	At this their anger boiled , and they began shouting , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019029	Soon the whole city was filled with confusion . Everyone rushed to the amphitheater , dragging along Gaius and Aristarchus , who were Paul’s traveling companions from Macedonia .
44019030	Paul wanted to go in , too , but the believers wouldn’t let him .
44019031	Some of the officials of the province , friends of Paul , also sent a message to him , begging him not to risk his life by entering the amphitheater .
44019032	Inside , the people were all shouting , some one thing and some another . Everything was in confusion . In fact , most of them didn’t even know why they were there .
44019033	The Jews in the crowd pushed Alexander forward and told him to explain the situation . He motioned for silence and tried to speak .
44019034	But when the crowd realized he was a Jew , they started shouting again and kept it up for about two hours : “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019035	At last the mayor was able to quiet them down enough to speak . “ Citizens of Ephesus , ” he said . “ Everyone knows that Ephesus is the official guardian of the temple of the great Artemis , whose image fell down to us from heaven .
44019036	Since this is an undeniable fact , you should stay calm and not do anything rash .
44019037	You have brought these men here , but they have stolen nothing from the temple and have not spoken against our goddess .
44019038	“ If Demetrius and the craftsmen have a case against them , the courts are in session and the officials can hear the case at once . Let them make formal charges .
44019039	And if there are complaints about other matters , they can be settled in a legal assembly .
44019040	I am afraid we are in danger of being charged with rioting by the Roman government , since there is no cause for all this commotion . And if Rome demands an explanation , we won’t know what to say . ”
44019041	Then he dismissed them , and they dispersed .
44020001	When the uproar was over , Paul sent for the believers and encouraged them . Then he said good-bye and left for Macedonia .
44020002	While there , he encouraged the believers in all the towns he passed through . Then he traveled down to Greece ,
44020003	where he stayed for three months . He was preparing to sail back to Syria when he discovered a plot by some Jews against his life , so he decided to return through Macedonia .
44020004	Several men were traveling with him . They were Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea ; Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica ; Gaius from Derbe ; Timothy ; and Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia .
44020005	They went on ahead and waited for us at Troas .
44020006	After the Passover ended , we boarded a ship at Philippi in Macedonia and five days later joined them in Troas , where we stayed a week .
44020007	On the first day of the week , we gathered with the local believers to share in the Lord’s Supper . Paul was preaching to them , and since he was leaving the next day , he kept talking until midnight .
44020008	The upstairs room where we met was lighted with many flickering lamps .
44020009	As Paul spoke on and on , a young man named Eutychus , sitting on the windowsill , became very drowsy . Finally , he fell sound asleep and dropped three stories to his death below .
44020010	Paul went down , bent over him , and took him into his arms . “ Don’t worry , ” he said , “ he’s alive ! ”
44020011	Then they all went back upstairs , shared in the Lord’s Supper , and ate together . Paul continued talking to them until dawn , and then he left .
44020012	Meanwhile , the young man was taken home unhurt , and everyone was greatly relieved .
44020013	Paul went by land to Assos , where he had arranged for us to join him , while we traveled by ship .
44020014	He joined us there , and we sailed together to Mitylene .
44020015	The next day we sailed past the island of Kios . The following day we crossed to the island of Samos , and a day later we arrived at Miletus .
44020016	Paul had decided to sail on past Ephesus , for he didn’t want to spend any more time in the province of Asia . He was hurrying to get to Jerusalem , if possible , in time for the Festival of Pentecost .
44020017	But when we landed at Miletus , he sent a message to the elders of the church at Ephesus , asking them to come and meet him .
44020018	When they arrived he declared , “ You know that from the day I set foot in the province of Asia until now
44020019	I have done the Lord’s work humbly and with many tears . I have endured the trials that came to me from the plots of the Jews .
44020020	I never shrank back from telling you what you needed to hear , either publicly or in your homes .
44020021	I have had one message for Jews and Greeks alikethe necessity of repenting from sin and turning to God , and of having faith in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	“ And now I am bound by the Spirit to go to Jerusalem . I don’t know what awaits me ,
44020023	except that the Holy Spirit tells me in city after city that jail and suffering lie ahead .
