44020024	But my life is worth nothing to me unless I use it for finishing the work assigned me by the Lord Jesusthe work of telling others the Good News about the wonderful grace of God .
44020025	“ And now I know that none of you to whom I have preached the Kingdom will ever see me again .
44020026	I declare today that I have been faithful . If anyone suffers eternal death , it’s not my fault ,
44020027	for I didn’t shrink from declaring all that God wants you to know .
44020028	“ So guard yourselves and God’s people . Feed and shepherd God’s flockhis church , purchased with his own blood over which the Holy Spirit has appointed you as elders .
44020029	I know that false teachers , like vicious wolves , will come in among you after I leave , not sparing the flock .
44020030	Even some men from your own group will rise up and distort the truth in order to draw a following .
44020031	Watch out ! Remember the three years I was with youmy constant watch and care over you night and day , and my many tears for you .
44020032	“ And now I entrust you to God and the message of his grace that is able to build you up and give you an inheritance with all those he has set apart for himself .
44020033	“ I have never coveted anyone’s silver or gold or fine clothes .
44020034	You know that these hands of mine have worked to supply my own needs and even the needs of those who were with me .
44020035	And I have been a constant example of how you can help those in need by working hard . You should remember the words of the Lord Jesus : ‘ It is more blessed to give than to receive . ’ ”
44020036	When he had finished speaking , he knelt and prayed with them .
44020037	They all cried as they embraced and kissed him good-bye .
44020038	They were sad most of all because he had said that they would never see him again . Then they escorted him down to the ship .
44021001	After saying farewell to the Ephesian elders , we sailed straight to the island of Cos . The next day we reached Rhodes and then went to Patara .
44021002	There we boarded a ship sailing for Phoenicia .
44021003	We sighted the island of Cyprus , passed it on our left , and landed at the harbor of Tyre , in Syria , where the ship was to unload its cargo .
44021004	We went ashore , found the local believers , and stayed with them a week . These believers prophesied through the Holy Spirit that Paul should not go on to Jerusalem .
44021005	When we returned to the ship at the end of the week , the entire congregation , including women and children , left the city and came down to the shore with us . There we knelt , prayed ,
44021006	and said our farewells . Then we went aboard , and they returned home .
44021007	The next stop after leaving Tyre was Ptolemais , where we greeted the brothers and sisters and stayed for one day .
44021008	The next day we went on to Caesarea and stayed at the home of Philip the Evangelist , one of the seven men who had been chosen to distribute food .
44021009	He had four unmarried daughters who had the gift of prophecy .
44021010	Several days later a man named Agabus , who also had the gift of prophecy , arrived from Judea .
44021011	He came over , took Paul’s belt , and bound his own feet and hands with it . Then he said , “ The Holy Spirit declares , ‘ So shall the owner of this belt be bound by the Jewish leaders in Jerusalem and turned over to the Gentiles . ’ ”
44021012	When we heard this , we and the local believers all begged Paul not to go on to Jerusalem .
44021013	But he said , “ Why all this weeping ? You are breaking my heart ! I am ready not only to be jailed at Jerusalem but even to die for the sake of the Lord Jesus . ”
44021014	When it was clear that we couldn’t persuade him , we gave up and said , “ The Lord’s will be done . ”
44021015	After this we packed our things and left for Jerusalem .
44021016	Some believers from Caesarea accompanied us , and they took us to the home of Mnason , a man originally from Cyprus and one of the early believers .
44021017	When we arrived , the brothers and sisters in Jerusalem welcomed us warmly .
44021018	The next day Paul went with us to meet with James , and all the elders of the Jerusalem church were present .
44021019	After greeting them , Paul gave a detailed account of the things God had accomplished among the Gentiles through his ministry .
44021020	After hearing this , they praised God . And then they said , “ You know , dear brother , how many thousands of Jews have also believed , and they all follow the law of Moses very seriously .
44021021	But the Jewish believers here in Jerusalem have been told that you are teaching all the Jews who live among the Gentiles to turn their backs on the laws of Moses . They’ve heard that you teach them not to circumcise their children or follow other Jewish customs .
44021022	What should we do ? They will certainly hear that you have come .
44021023	“ Here’s what we want you to do . We have four men here who have completed their vow .
44021024	Go with them to the Temple and join them in the purification ceremony , paying for them to have their heads ritually shaved . Then everyone will know that the rumors are all false and that you yourself observe the Jewish laws .
44021025	“ As for the Gentile believers , they should do what we already told them in a letter : They should abstain from eating food offered to idols , from consuming blood or the meat of strangled animals , and from sexual immorality . ”
44021026	So Paul went to the Temple the next day with the other men . They had already started the purification ritual , so he publicly announced the date when their vows would end and sacrifices would be offered for each of them .
44021027	The seven days were almost ended when some Jews from the province of Asia saw Paul in the Temple and roused a mob against him . They grabbed him ,
44021028	yelling , “ Men of Israel , help us ! This is the man who preaches against our people everywhere and tells everybody to disobey the Jewish laws . He speaks against the Templeand even defiles this holy place by bringing in Gentiles . ”
44021029	( For earlier that day they had seen him in the city with Trophimus , a Gentile from Ephesus , and they assumed Paul had taken him into the Temple . )
44021030	The whole city was rocked by these accusations , and a great riot followed . Paul was grabbed and dragged out of the Temple , and immediately the gates were closed behind him .
44021031	As they were trying to kill him , word reached the commander of the Roman regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
44021032	He immediately called out his soldiers and officers and ran down among the crowd . When the mob saw the commander and the troops coming , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	Then the commander arrested him and ordered him bound with two chains . He asked the crowd who he was and what he had done .
44021034	Some shouted one thing and some another . Since he couldn’t find out the truth in all the uproar and confusion , he ordered that Paul be taken to the fortress .
44021035	As Paul reached the stairs , the mob grew so violent the soldiers had to lift him to their shoulders to protect him .
44021036	And the crowd followed behind , shouting , “ Kill him , kill him ! ”
44021037	As Paul was about to be taken inside , he said to the commander , “ May I have a word with you ? ” “ Do you know Greek ? ” the commander asked , surprised .
44021038	“ Aren’t you the Egyptian who led a rebellion some time ago and took 4,000 members of the Assassins out into the desert ? ”
44021039	“ No , ” Paul replied , “ I am a Jew and a citizen of Tarsus in Cilicia , which is an important city . Please , let me talk to these people . ”
44021040	The commander agreed , so Paul stood on the stairs and motioned to the people to be quiet . Soon a deep silence enveloped the crowd , and he addressed them in their own language , Aramaic .
44022001	“ Brothers and esteemed fathers , ” Paul said , “ listen to me as I offer my defense . ”
44022002	When they heard him speaking in their own language , the silence was even greater .
44022003	Then Paul said , “ I am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , and I was brought up and educated here in Jerusalem under Gamaliel . As his student , I was carefully trained in our Jewish laws and customs . I became very zealous to honor God in everything I did , just like all of you today .
44022004	And I persecuted the followers of the Way , hounding some to death , arresting both men and women and throwing them in prison .
44022005	The high priest and the whole council of elders can testify that this is so . For I received letters from them to our Jewish brothers in Damascus , authorizing me to bring the Christians from there to Jerusalem , in chains , to be punished .
44022006	“ As I was on the road , approaching Damascus about noon , a very bright light from heaven suddenly shone down around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? ’
44022008	“ ‘ Who are you , lord ? ’ I asked . “ And the voice replied , ‘ I am Jesus the Nazarene , the one you are persecuting . ’
44022009	The people with me saw the light but didn’t understand the voice speaking to me .
44022010	“ I asked , ‘ What should I do , Lord ? ’ “ And the Lord told me , ‘ Get up and go into Damascus , and there you will be told everything you are to do . ’
44022011	“ I was blinded by the intense light and had to be led by the hand to Damascus by my companions .
44022012	A man named Ananias lived there . He was a godly man , deeply devoted to the law , and well regarded by all the Jews of Damascus .
44022013	He came and stood beside me and said , ‘ Brother Saul , regain your sight . ’ And that very moment I could see him !
44022014	“ Then he told me , ‘ The God of our ancestors has chosen you to know his will and to see the Righteous One and hear him speak .
44022015	For you are to be his witness , telling everyone what you have seen and heard .
44022016	What are you waiting for ? Get up and be baptized . Have your sins washed away by calling on the name of the Lord . ’
44022017	“ After I returned to Jerusalem , I was praying in the Temple and fell into a trance .
44022018	I saw a vision of Jesus saying to me , ‘ Hurry ! Leave Jerusalem , for the people here won’t accept your testimony about me . ’
44022019	“ ‘ But Lord , ’ I argued , ‘ they certainly know that in every synagogue I imprisoned and beat those who believed in you .
44022020	And I was in complete agreement when your witness Stephen was killed . I stood by and kept the coats they took off when they stoned him . ’
44022021	“ But the Lord said to me , ‘ Go , for I will send you far away to the Gentiles ! ’ ”
44022022	The crowd listened until Paul said that word . Then they all began to shout , “ Away with such a fellow ! He isn’t fit to live ! ”
44022023	They yelled , threw off their coats , and tossed handfuls of dust into the air .
44022024	The commander brought Paul inside and ordered him lashed with whips to make him confess his crime . He wanted to find out why the crowd had become so furious .
44022025	When they tied Paul down to lash him , Paul said to the officer standing there , “ Is it legal for you to whip a Roman citizen who hasn’t even been tried ? ”
44022026	When the officer heard this , he went to the commander and asked , “ What are you doing ? This man is a Roman citizen ! ”
44022027	So the commander went over and asked Paul , “ Tell me , are you a Roman citizen ? ” “ Yes , I certainly am , ” Paul replied .
44022028	“ I am , too , ” the commander muttered , “ and it cost me plenty ! ” Paul answered , “ But I am a citizen by birth ! ”
44022029	The soldiers who were about to interrogate Paul quickly withdrew when they heard he was a Roman citizen , and the commander was frightened because he had ordered him bound and whipped .
44022030	The next day the commander ordered the leading priests into session with the Jewish high council . He wanted to find out what the trouble was all about , so he released Paul to have him stand before them .
44023001	Gazing intently at the high council , Paul began : “ Brothers , I have always lived before God with a clear conscience ! ”
44023002	Instantly Ananias the high priest commanded those close to Paul to slap him on the mouth .
44023003	But Paul said to him , “ God will slap you , you corrupt hypocrite ! What kind of judge are you to break the law yourself by ordering me struck like that ? ”
44023004	Those standing near Paul said to him , “ Do you dare to insult God’s high priest ? ”
44023005	“ I’m sorry , brothers . I didn’t realize he was the high priest , ” Paul replied , “ for the Scriptures say , ‘ You must not speak evil of any of your rulers . ’ ”
44023006	Paul realized that some members of the high council were Sadducees and some were Pharisees , so he shouted , “ Brothers , I am a Pharisee , as were my ancestors ! And I am on trial because my hope is in the resurrection of the dead ! ”
44023007	This divided the councilthe Pharisees against the Sadducees
44023008	for the Sadducees say there is no resurrection or angels or spirits , but the Pharisees believe in all of these .
44023009	So there was a great uproar . Some of the teachers of religious law who were Pharisees jumped up and began to argue forcefully . “ We see nothing wrong with him , ” they shouted . “ Perhaps a spirit or an angel spoke to him . ”
44023010	As the conflict grew more violent , the commander was afraid they would tear Paul apart . So he ordered his soldiers to go and rescue him by force and take him back to the fortress .
44023011	That night the Lord appeared to Paul and said , “ Be encouraged , Paul . Just as you have been a witness to me here in Jerusalem , you must preach the Good News in Rome as well . ”
44023012	The next morning a group of Jews got together and bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink until they had killed Paul .
44023013	There were more than forty of them in the conspiracy .
44023014	They went to the leading priests and elders and told them , “ We have bound ourselves with an oath to eat nothing until we have killed Paul .
44023015	So you and the high council should ask the commander to bring Paul back to the council again . Pretend you want to examine his case more fully . We will kill him on the way . ”
44023016	But Paul’s nephewhis sister’s sonheard of their plan and went to the fortress and told Paul .
44023017	Paul called for one of the Roman officers and said , “ Take this young man to the commander . He has something important to tell him . ”
44023018	So the officer did , explaining , “ Paul , the prisoner , called me over and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you . ”
44023019	The commander took his hand , led him aside , and asked , “ What is it you want to tell me ? ”
44023020	Paul’s nephew told him , “ Some Jews are going to ask you to bring Paul before the high council tomorrow , pretending they want to get some more information .
44023021	But don’t do it ! There are more than forty men hiding along the way ready to ambush him . They have vowed not to eat or drink anything until they have killed him . They are ready now , just waiting for your consent . ”
44023022	“ Don’t let anyone know you told me this , ” the commander warned the young man .
44023023	Then the commander called two of his officers and ordered , “ Get 200 soldiers ready to leave for Caesarea at nine o’clock tonight . Also take 200 spearmen and 70 mounted troops .
44023024	Provide horses for Paul to ride , and get him safely to Governor Felix . ”
44023025	Then he wrote this letter to the governor :
44023026	“ From Claudius Lysias , to his Excellency , Governor Felix : Greetings !
44023027	“ This man was seized by some Jews , and they were about to kill him when I arrived with the troops . When I learned that he was a Roman citizen , I removed him to safety .
44023028	Then I took him to their high council to try to learn the basis of the accusations against him .
44023029	I soon discovered the charge was something regarding their religious lawcertainly nothing worthy of imprisonment or death .
44023030	But when I was informed of a plot to kill him , I immediately sent him on to you . I have told his accusers to bring their charges before you . ”
44023031	So that night , as ordered , the soldiers took Paul as far as Antipatris .
44023032	They returned to the fortress the next morning , while the mounted troops took him on to Caesarea .
44023033	When they arrived in Caesarea , they presented Paul and the letter to Governor Felix .
44023034	He read it and then asked Paul what province he was from . “ Cilicia , ” Paul answered .
44023035	“ I will hear your case myself when your accusers arrive , ” the governor told him . Then the governor ordered him kept in the prison at Herod’s headquarters .
44024001	Five days later Ananias , the high priest , arrived with some of the Jewish elders and the lawyer Tertullus , to present their case against Paul to the governor .
44024002	When Paul was called in , Tertullus presented the charges against Paul in the following address to the governor : “ You have provided a long period of peace for us Jews and with foresight have enacted reforms for us .
44024003	For all of this , Your Excellency , we are very grateful to you .
44024004	But I don’t want to bore you , so please give me your attention for only a moment .
44024005	We have found this man to be a troublemaker who is constantly stirring up riots among the Jews all over the world . He is a ringleader of the cult known as the Nazarenes .
44024006	Furthermore , he was trying to desecrate the Temple when we arrested him .
44024008	You can find out the truth of our accusations by examining him yourself . ”
44024009	Then the other Jews chimed in , declaring that everything Tertullus said was true .
44024010	The governor then motioned for Paul to speak . Paul said , “ I know , sir , that you have been a judge of Jewish affairs for many years , so I gladly present my defense before you .
44024011	You can quickly discover that I arrived in Jerusalem no more than twelve days ago to worship at the Temple .
44024012	My accusers never found me arguing with anyone in the Temple , nor stirring up a riot in any synagogue or on the streets of the city .
44024013	These men cannot prove the things they accuse me of doing .
44024014	“ But I admit that I follow the Way , which they call a cult . I worship the God of our ancestors , and I firmly believe the Jewish law and everything written in the prophets .
44024015	I have the same hope in God that these men have , that he will raise both the righteous and the unrighteous .
44024016	Because of this , I always try to maintain a clear conscience before God and all people .
44024017	“ After several years away , I returned to Jerusalem with money to aid my people and to offer sacrifices to God .
44024018	My accusers saw me in the Temple as I was completing a purification ceremony . There was no crowd around me and no rioting .
44024019	But some Jews from the province of Asia were thereand they ought to be here to bring charges if they have anything against me !
44024020	Ask these men here what crime the Jewish high council found me guilty of ,
44024021	except for the one time I shouted out , ‘ I am on trial before you today because I believe in the resurrection of the dead ! ’ ”
44024022	At that point Felix , who was quite familiar with the Way , adjourned the hearing and said , “ Wait until Lysias , the garrison commander , arrives . Then I will decide the case . ”
44024023	He ordered an officer to keep Paul in custody but to give him some freedom and allow his friends to visit him and take care of his needs .
44024024	A few days later Felix came back with his wife , Drusilla , who was Jewish . Sending for Paul , they listened as he told them about faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	As he reasoned with them about righteousness and self-control and the coming day of judgment , Felix became frightened . “ Go away for now , ” he replied . “ When it is more convenient , I’ll call for you again . ”
44024026	He also hoped that Paul would bribe him , so he sent for him quite often and talked with him .
44024027	After two years went by in this way , Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus . And because Felix wanted to gain favor with the Jewish people , he left Paul in prison .
44025001	Three days after Festus arrived in Caesarea to take over his new responsibilities , he left for Jerusalem ,
44025002	where the leading priests and other Jewish leaders met with him and made their accusations against Paul .
44025003	They asked Festus as a favor to transfer Paul to Jerusalem ( planning to ambush and kill him on the way ) .
44025004	But Festus replied that Paul was at Caesarea and he himself would be returning there soon .
44025005	So he said , “ Those of you in authority can return with me . If Paul has done anything wrong , you can make your accusations . ”
44025006	About eight or ten days later Festus returned to Caesarea , and on the following day he took his seat in court and ordered that Paul be brought in .
44025007	When Paul arrived , the Jewish leaders from Jerusalem gathered around and made many serious accusations they couldn’t prove .
44025008	Paul denied the charges . “ I am not guilty of any crime against the Jewish laws or the Temple or the Roman government , ” he said .
44025009	Then Festus , wanting to please the Jews , asked him , “ Are you willing to go to Jerusalem and stand trial before me there ? ”
44025010	But Paul replied , “ No ! This is the official Roman court , so I ought to be tried right here . You know very well I am not guilty of harming the Jews .
44025011	If I have done something worthy of death , I don’t refuse to die . But if I am innocent , no one has a right to turn me over to these men to kill me . I appeal to Caesar ! ”
44025012	Festus conferred with his advisers and then replied , “ Very well ! You have appealed to Caesar , and to Caesar you will go ! ”
44025013	A few days later King Agrippa arrived with his sister , Bernice , to pay their respects to Festus .
44025014	During their stay of several days , Festus discussed Paul’s case with the king . “ There is a prisoner here , ” he told him , “ whose case was left for me by Felix .
44025015	When I was in Jerusalem , the leading priests and Jewish elders pressed charges against him and asked me to condemn him .
44025016	I pointed out to them that Roman law does not convict people without a trial . They must be given an opportunity to confront their accusers and defend themselves .
44025017	“ When his accusers came here for the trial , I didn’t delay . I called the case the very next day and ordered Paul brought in .
44025018	But the accusations made against him weren’t any of the crimes I expected .
44025019	Instead , it was something about their religion and a dead man named Jesus , who Paul insists is alive .
44025020	I was at a loss to know how to investigate these things , so I asked him whether he would be willing to stand trial on these charges in Jerusalem .
44025021	But Paul appealed to have his case decided by the emperor . So I ordered that he be held in custody until I could arrange to send him to Caesar . ”
44025022	“ I’d like to hear the man myself , ” Agrippa said . And Festus replied , “ You willtomorrow ! ”
44025023	So the next day Agrippa and Bernice arrived at the auditorium with great pomp , accompanied by military officers and prominent men of the city . Festus ordered that Paul be brought in .
44025024	Then Festus said , “ King Agrippa and all who are here , this is the man whose death is demanded by all the Jews , both here and in Jerusalem .
44025025	But in my opinion he has done nothing deserving death . However , since he appealed his case to the emperor , I have decided to send him to Rome .
44025026	“ But what shall I write the emperor ? For there is no clear charge against him . So I have brought him before all of you , and especially you , King Agrippa , so that after we examine him , I might have something to write .
44025027	For it makes no sense to send a prisoner to the emperor without specifying the charges against him ! ”
44026001	Then Agrippa said to Paul , “ You may speak in your defense . ” So Paul , gesturing with his hand , started his defense :
44026002	“ I am fortunate , King Agrippa , that you are the one hearing my defense today against all these accusations made by the Jewish leaders ,
44026003	for I know you are an expert on all Jewish customs and controversies . Now please listen to me patiently !
44026004	“ As the Jewish leaders are well aware , I was given a thorough Jewish training from my earliest childhood among my own people and in Jerusalem .
44026005	If they would admit it , they know that I have been a member of the Pharisees , the strictest sect of our religion .
44026006	Now I am on trial because of my hope in the fulfillment of God’s promise made to our ancestors .
44026007	In fact , that is why the twelve tribes of Israel zealously worship God night and day , and they share the same hope I have . Yet , Your Majesty , they accuse me for having this hope !
44026008	Why does it seem incredible to any of you that God can raise the dead ?
44026009	“ I used to believe that I ought to do everything I could to oppose the very name of Jesus the Nazarene .
44026010	Indeed , I did just that in Jerusalem . Authorized by the leading priests , I caused many believers there to be sent to prison . And I cast my vote against them when they were condemned to death .
44026011	Many times I had them punished in the synagogues to get them to curse Jesus . I was so violently opposed to them that I even chased them down in foreign cities .
44026012	“ One day I was on such a mission to Damascus , armed with the authority and commission of the leading priests .
44026013	About noon , Your Majesty , as I was on the road , a light from heaven brighter than the sun shone down on me and my companions .
44026014	We all fell down , and I heard a voice saying to me in Aramaic , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? It is useless for you to fight against my will . ’
44026015	“ ‘ Who are you , lord ? ’ I asked . “ And the Lord replied , ‘ I am Jesus , the one you are persecuting .
44026016	Now get to your feet ! For I have appeared to you to appoint you as my servant and witness . You are to tell the world what you have seen and what I will show you in the future .
44026017	And I will rescue you from both your own people and the Gentiles . Yes , I am sending you to the Gentiles
44026018	to open their eyes , so they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God . Then they will receive forgiveness for their sins and be given a place among God’s people , who are set apart by faith in me . ’
44026019	“ And so , King Agrippa , I obeyed that vision from heaven .
44026020	I preached first to those in Damascus , then in Jerusalem and throughout all Judea , and also to the Gentiles , that all must repent of their sins and turn to Godand prove they have changed by the good things they do .
44026021	Some Jews arrested me in the Temple for preaching this , and they tried to kill me .
44026022	But God has protected me right up to this present time so I can testify to everyone , from the least to the greatest . I teach nothing except what the prophets and Moses said would happen
44026023	that the Messiah would suffer and be the first to rise from the dead , and in this way announce God’s light to Jews and Gentiles alike . ”
44026024	Suddenly , Festus shouted , “ Paul , you are insane . Too much study has made you crazy ! ”
44026025	But Paul replied , “ I am not insane , Most Excellent Festus . What I am saying is the sober truth .
44026026	And King Agrippa knows about these things . I speak boldly , for I am sure these events are all familiar to him , for they were not done in a corner !
44026027	King Agrippa , do you believe the prophets ? I know you do ”
44026028	Agrippa interrupted him . “ Do you think you can persuade me to become a Christian so quickly ? ”
44026029	Paul replied , “ Whether quickly or not , I pray to God that both you and everyone here in this audience might become the same as I am , except for these chains . ”
44026030	Then the king , the governor , Bernice , and all the others stood and left .
44026031	As they went out , they talked it over and agreed , “ This man hasn’t done anything to deserve death or imprisonment . ”
44026032	And Agrippa said to Festus , “ He could have been set free if he hadn’t appealed to Caesar . ”
44027001	When the time came , we set sail for Italy . Paul and several other prisoners were placed in the custody of a Roman officer named Julius , a captain of the Imperial Regiment .
44027002	Aristarchus , a Macedonian from Thessalonica , was also with us . We left on a ship whose home port was Adramyttium on the northwest coast of the province of Asia ; it was scheduled to make several stops at ports along the coast of the province .
44027003	The next day when we docked at Sidon , Julius was very kind to Paul and let him go ashore to visit with friends so they could provide for his needs .
44027004	Putting out to sea from there , we encountered strong headwinds that made it difficult to keep the ship on course , so we sailed north of Cyprus between the island and the mainland .
44027005	Keeping to the open sea , we passed along the coast of Cilicia and Pamphylia , landing at Myra , in the province of Lycia .
44027006	There the commanding officer found an Egyptian ship from Alexandria that was bound for Italy , and he put us on board .
44027007	We had several days of slow sailing , and after great difficulty we finally neared Cnidus . But the wind was against us , so we sailed across to Crete and along the sheltered coast of the island , past the cape of Salmone .
44027008	We struggled along the coast with great difficulty and finally arrived at Fair Havens , near the town of Lasea .
44027009	We had lost a lot of time . The weather was becoming dangerous for sea travel because it was so late in the fall , and Paul spoke to the ship’s officers about it .
44027010	“ Men , ” he said , “ I believe there is trouble ahead if we go onshipwreck , loss of cargo , and danger to our lives as well . ”
44027011	But the officer in charge of the prisoners listened more to the ship’s captain and the owner than to Paul .
44027012	And since Fair Havens was an exposed harbora poor place to spend the wintermost of the crew wanted to go on to Phoenix , farther up the coast of Crete , and spend the winter there . Phoenix was a good harbor with only a southwest and northwest exposure .
44027013	When a light wind began blowing from the south , the sailors thought they could make it . So they pulled up anchor and sailed close to the shore of Crete .
44027014	But the weather changed abruptly , and a wind of typhoon strength ( called a “ northeaster ” ) burst across the island and blew us out to sea .
44027015	The sailors couldn’t turn the ship into the wind , so they gave up and let it run before the gale .
44027016	We sailed along the sheltered side of a small island named Cauda , where with great difficulty we hoisted aboard the lifeboat being towed behind us .
44027017	Then the sailors bound ropes around the hull of the ship to strengthen it . They were afraid of being driven across to the sandbars of Syrtis off the African coast , so they lowered the sea anchor to slow the ship and were driven before the wind .
44027018	The next day , as gale-force winds continued to batter the ship , the crew began throwing the cargo overboard .
44027019	The following day they even took some of the ship’s gear and threw it overboard .
44027020	The terrible storm raged for many days , blotting out the sun and the stars , until at last all hope was gone .
44027021	No one had eaten for a long time . Finally , Paul called the crew together and said , “ Men , you should have listened to me in the first place and not left Crete . You would have avoided all this damage and loss .
44027022	But take courage ! None of you will lose your lives , even though the ship will go down .
44027023	For last night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve stood beside me ,
44027024	and he said , ‘ Don’t be afraid , Paul , for you will surely stand trial before Caesar ! What’s more , God in his goodness has granted safety to everyone sailing with you . ’
44027025	So take courage ! For I believe God . It will be just as he said .
44027026	But we will be shipwrecked on an island . ”
44027027	About midnight on the fourteenth night of the storm , as we were being driven across the Sea of Adria , the sailors sensed land was near .
44027028	They dropped a weighted line and found that the water was 120 feet deep . But a little later they measured again and found it was only 90 feet deep .
44027029	At this rate they were afraid we would soon be driven against the rocks along the shore , so they threw out four anchors from the back of the ship and prayed for daylight .
44027030	Then the sailors tried to abandon the ship ; they lowered the lifeboat as though they were going to put out anchors from the front of the ship .
44027031	But Paul said to the commanding officer and the soldiers , “ You will all die unless the sailors stay aboard . ”
44027032	So the soldiers cut the ropes to the lifeboat and let it drift away .
44027033	Just as day was dawning , Paul urged everyone to eat . “ You have been so worried that you haven’t touched food for two weeks , ” he said .
44027034	“ Please eat something now for your own good . For not a hair of your heads will perish . ”
44027035	Then he took some bread , gave thanks to God before them all , and broke off a piece and ate it .
44027036	Then everyone was encouraged and began to eat
44027037	all 276 of us who were on board .
44027038	After eating , the crew lightened the ship further by throwing the cargo of wheat overboard .
44027039	When morning dawned , they didn’t recognize the coastline , but they saw a bay with a beach and wondered if they could get to shore by running the ship aground .
44027040	So they cut off the anchors and left them in the sea . Then they lowered the rudders , raised the foresail , and headed toward shore .
44027041	But they hit a shoal and ran the ship aground too soon . The bow of the ship stuck fast , while the stern was repeatedly smashed by the force of the waves and began to break apart .
44027042	The soldiers wanted to kill the prisoners to make sure they didn’t swim ashore and escape .
44027043	But the commanding officer wanted to spare Paul , so he didn’t let them carry out their plan . Then he ordered all who could swim to jump overboard first and make for land .
44027044	The others held on to planks or debris from the broken ship . So everyone escaped safely to shore .
44028001	Once we were safe on shore , we learned that we were on the island of Malta .
44028002	The people of the island were very kind to us . It was cold and rainy , so they built a fire on the shore to welcome us .
44028003	As Paul gathered an armful of sticks and was laying them on the fire , a poisonous snake , driven out by the heat , bit him on the hand .
44028004	The people of the island saw it hanging from his hand and said to each other , “ A murderer , no doubt ! Though he escaped the sea , justice will not permit him to live . ”
44028005	But Paul shook off the snake into the fire and was unharmed .
44028006	The people waited for him to swell up or suddenly drop dead . But when they had waited a long time and saw that he wasn’t harmed , they changed their minds and decided he was a god .
44028007	Near the shore where we landed was an estate belonging to Publius , the chief official of the island . He welcomed us and treated us kindly for three days .
44028008	As it happened , Publius’s father was ill with fever and dysentery . Paul went in and prayed for him , and laying his hands on him , he healed him .
44028009	Then all the other sick people on the island came and were healed .
44028010	As a result we were showered with honors , and when the time came to sail , people supplied us with everything we would need for the trip .
44028011	It was three months after the shipwreck that we set sail on another ship that had wintered at the islandan Alexandrian ship with the twin gods as its figurehead .
44028012	Our first stop was Syracuse , where we stayed three days .
44028013	From there we sailed across to Rhegium . A day later a south wind began blowing , so the following day we sailed up the coast to Puteoli .
44028014	There we found some believers , who invited us to spend a week with them . And so we came to Rome .
44028015	The brothers and sisters in Rome had heard we were coming , and they came to meet us at the Forum on the Appian Way . Others joined us at The Three Taverns . When Paul saw them , he was encouraged and thanked God .
44028016	When we arrived in Rome , Paul was permitted to have his own private lodging , though he was guarded by a soldier .
44028017	Three days after Paul’s arrival , he called together the local Jewish leaders . He said to them , “ Brothers , I was arrested in Jerusalem and handed over to the Roman government , even though I had done nothing against our people or the customs of our ancestors .
44028018	The Romans tried me and wanted to release me , because they found no cause for the death sentence .
44028019	But when the Jewish leaders protested the decision , I felt it necessary to appeal to Caesar , even though I had no desire to press charges against my own people .
44028020	I asked you to come here today so we could get acquainted and so I could explain to you that I am bound with this chain because I believe that the hope of Israelthe Messiahhas already come . ”
44028021	They replied , “ We have had no letters from Judea or reports against you from anyone who has come here .
44028022	But we want to hear what you believe , for the only thing we know about this movement is that it is denounced everywhere . ”
44028023	So a time was set , and on that day a large number of people came to Paul’s lodging . He explained and testified about the Kingdom of God and tried to persuade them about Jesus from the Scriptures . Using the law of Moses and the books of the prophets , he spoke to them from morning until evening .
44028024	Some were persuaded by the things he said , but others did not believe .
44028025	And after they had argued back and forth among themselves , they left with this final word from Paul : “ The Holy Spirit was right when he said to your ancestors through Isaiah the prophet ,
44028026	‘ Go and say to this people : When you hear what I say , you will not understand . When you see what I do , you will not comprehend .
44028027	For the hearts of these people are hardened , and their ears cannot hear , and they have closed their eyes so their eyes cannot see , and their ears cannot hear , and their hearts cannot understand , and they cannot turn to me and let me heal them . ’
44028028	So I want you to know that this salvation from God has also been offered to the Gentiles , and they will accept it . ”
44028030	For the next two years , Paul lived in Rome at his own expense . He welcomed all who visited him ,
44028031	boldly proclaiming the Kingdom of God and teaching about the Lord Jesus Christ . And no one tried to stop him .
45001001	This letter is from Paul , a slave of Christ Jesus , chosen by God to be an apostle and sent out to preach his Good News .
45001002	God promised this Good News long ago through his prophets in the holy Scriptures .
45001003	The Good News is about his Son . In his earthly life he was born into King David’s family line ,
45001004	and he was shown to be the Son of God when he was raised from the dead by the power of the Holy Spirit . He is Jesus Christ our Lord .
45001005	Through Christ , God has given us the privilege and authority as apostles to tell Gentiles everywhere what God has done for them , so that they will believe and obey him , bringing glory to his name .
45001006	And you are included among those Gentiles who have been called to belong to Jesus Christ .
45001007	I am writing to all of you in Rome who are loved by God and are called to be his own holy people . May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace .
45001008	Let me say first that I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you , because your faith in him is being talked about all over the world .
45001009	God knows how often I pray for you . Day and night I bring you and your needs in prayer to God , whom I serve with all my heart by spreading the Good News about his Son .
45001010	One of the things I always pray for is the opportunity , God willing , to come at last to see you .
45001011	For I long to visit you so I can bring you some spiritual gift that will help you grow strong in the Lord .
45001012	When we get together , I want to encourage you in your faith , but I also want to be encouraged by yours .
45001013	I want you to know , dear brothers and sisters , that I planned many times to visit you , but I was prevented until now . I want to work among you and see spiritual fruit , just as I have seen among other Gentiles .
45001014	For I have a great sense of obligation to people in both the civilized world and the rest of the world , to the educated and uneducated alike .
45001015	So I am eager to come to you in Rome , too , to preach the Good News .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of this Good News about Christ . It is the power of God at work , saving everyone who believesthe Jew first and also the Gentile .
45001017	This Good News tells us how God makes us right in his sight . This is accomplished from start to finish by faith . As the Scriptures say , “ It is through faith that a righteous person has life . ”
45001018	But God shows his anger from heaven against all sinful , wicked people who suppress the truth by their wickedness .
45001019	They know the truth about God because he has made it obvious to them .
45001020	For ever since the world was created , people have seen the earth and sky . Through everything God made , they can clearly see his invisible qualitieshis eternal power and divine nature . So they have no excuse for not knowing God .
45001021	Yes , they knew God , but they wouldn’t worship him as God or even give him thanks . And they began to think up foolish ideas of what God was like . As a result , their minds became dark and confused .
45001022	Claiming to be wise , they instead became utter fools .
45001023	And instead of worshiping the glorious , ever-living God , they worshiped idols made to look like mere people and birds and animals and reptiles .
45001024	So God abandoned them to do whatever shameful things their hearts desired . As a result , they did vile and degrading things with each other’s bodies .
45001025	They traded the truth about God for a lie . So they worshiped and served the things God created instead of the Creator himself , who is worthy of eternal praise ! Amen .
45001026	That is why God abandoned them to their shameful desires . Even the women turned against the natural way to have sex and instead indulged in sex with each other .
45001027	And the men , instead of having normal sexual relations with women , burned with lust for each other . Men did shameful things with other men , and as a result of this sin , they suffered within themselves the penalty they deserved .
45001028	Since they thought it foolish to acknowledge God , he abandoned them to their foolish thinking and let them do things that should never be done .
45001029	Their lives became full of every kind of wickedness , sin , greed , hate , envy , murder , quarreling , deception , malicious behavior , and gossip .
45001030	They are backstabbers , haters of God , insolent , proud , and boastful . They invent new ways of sinning , and they disobey their parents .
45001031	They refuse to understand , break their promises , are heartless , and have no mercy .
45001032	They know God’s justice requires that those who do these things deserve to die , yet they do them anyway . Worse yet , they encourage others to do them , too .
45002001	You may think you can condemn such people , but you are just as bad , and you have no excuse ! When you say they are wicked and should be punished , you are condemning yourself , for you who judge others do these very same things .
45002002	And we know that God , in his justice , will punish anyone who does such things .
45002003	Since you judge others for doing these things , why do you think you can avoid God’s judgment when you do the same things ?
45002004	Don’t you see how wonderfully kind , tolerant , and patient God is with you ? Does this mean nothing to you ? Can’t you see that his kindness is intended to turn you from your sin ?
45002005	But because you are stubborn and refuse to turn from your sin , you are storing up terrible punishment for yourself . For a day of anger is coming , when God’s righteous judgment will be revealed .
45002006	He will judge everyone according to what they have done .
45002007	He will give eternal life to those who keep on doing good , seeking after the glory and honor and immortality that God offers .
45002008	But he will pour out his anger and wrath on those who live for themselves , who refuse to obey the truth and instead live lives of wickedness .
45002009	There will be trouble and calamity for everyone who keeps on doing what is evilfor the Jew first and also for the Gentile .
45002010	But there will be glory and honor and peace from God for all who do goodfor the Jew first and also for the Gentile .
45002011	For God does not show favoritism .
45002012	When the Gentiles sin , they will be destroyed , even though they never had God’s written law . And the Jews , who do have God’s law , will be judged by that law when they fail to obey it .
45002013	For merely listening to the law doesn’t make us right with God . It is obeying the law that makes us right in his sight .
45002014	Even Gentiles , who do not have God’s written law , show that they know his law when they instinctively obey it , even without having heard it .
45002015	They demonstrate that God’s law is written in their hearts , for their own conscience and thoughts either accuse them or tell them they are doing right .
45002016	And this is the message I proclaimthat the day is coming when God , through Christ Jesus , will judge everyone’s secret life .
45002017	You who call yourselves Jews are relying on God’s law , and you boast about your special relationship with him .
45002018	You know what he wants ; you know what is right because you have been taught his law .
45002019	You are convinced that you are a guide for the blind and a light for people who are lost in darkness .
45002020	You think you can instruct the ignorant and teach children the ways of God . For you are certain that God’s law gives you complete knowledge and truth .
45002021	Well then , if you teach others , why don’t you teach yourself ? You tell others not to steal , but do you steal ?
45002022	You say it is wrong to commit adultery , but do you commit adultery ? You condemn idolatry , but do you use items stolen from pagan temples ?
45002023	You are so proud of knowing the law , but you dishonor God by breaking it .
45002024	No wonder the Scriptures say , “ The Gentiles blaspheme the name of God because of you . ”
45002025	The Jewish ceremony of circumcision has value only if you obey God’s law . But if you don’t obey God’s law , you are no better off than an uncircumcised Gentile .
45002026	And if the Gentiles obey God’s law , won’t God declare them to be his own people ?
45002027	In fact , uncircumcised Gentiles who keep God’s law will condemn you Jews who are circumcised and possess God’s law but don’t obey it .
45002028	For you are not a true Jew just because you were born of Jewish parents or because you have gone through the ceremony of circumcision .
45002029	No , a true Jew is one whose heart is right with God . And true circumcision is not merely obeying the letter of the law ; rather , it is a change of heart produced by God’s Spirit . And a person with a changed heart seeks praise from God , not from people .
45003001	Then what’s the advantage of being a Jew ? Is there any value in the ceremony of circumcision ?
45003002	Yes , there are great benefits ! First of all , the Jews were entrusted with the whole revelation of God .
45003003	True , some of them were unfaithful ; but just because they were unfaithful , does that mean God will be unfaithful ?
45003004	Of course not ! Even if everyone else is a liar , God is true . As the Scriptures say about him , “ You will be proved right in what you say , and you will win your case in court . ”
45003005	“ But , ” some might say , “ our sinfulness serves a good purpose , for it helps people see how righteous God is . Isn’t it unfair , then , for him to punish us ? ” ( This is merely a human point of view . )
45003006	Of course not ! If God were not entirely fair , how would he be qualified to judge the world ?
45003007	“ But , ” someone might still argue , “ how can God condemn me as a sinner if my dishonesty highlights his truthfulness and brings him more glory ? ”
45003008	And some people even slander us by claiming that we say , “ The more we sin , the better it is ! ” Those who say such things deserve to be condemned .
45003009	Well then , should we conclude that we Jews are better than others ? No , not at all , for we have already shown that all people , whether Jews or Gentiles , are under the power of sin .
45003010	As the Scriptures say , “ No one is righteous not even one .
45003011	No one is truly wise ; no one is seeking God .
45003012	All have turned away ; all have become useless . No one does good , not a single one . ”
45003013	“ Their talk is foul , like the stench from an open grave . Their tongues are filled with lies . ” “ Snake venom drips from their lips . ”
45003014	“ Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness . ”
45003015	“ They rush to commit murder .
45003016	Destruction and misery always follow them .
45003017	They don’t know where to find peace . ”
45003018	“ They have no fear of God at all . ”
45003019	Obviously , the law applies to those to whom it was given , for its purpose is to keep people from having excuses , and to show that the entire world is guilty before God .
45003020	For no one can ever be made right with God by doing what the law commands . The law simply shows us how sinful we are .
45003021	But now God has shown us a way to be made right with him without keeping the requirements of the law , as was promised in the writings of Moses and the prophets long ago .
45003022	We are made right with God by placing our faith in Jesus Christ . And this is true for everyone who believes , no matter who we are .
45003023	For everyone has sinned ; we all fall short of God’s glorious standard .
45003024	Yet God , with undeserved kindness , declares that we are righteous . He did this through Christ Jesus when he freed us from the penalty for our sins .
45003025	For God presented Jesus as the sacrifice for sin . People are made right with God when they believe that Jesus sacrificed his life , shedding his blood . This sacrifice shows that God was being fair when he held back and did not punish those who sinned in times past ,
45003026	for he was looking ahead and including them in what he would do in this present time . God did this to demonstrate his righteousness , for he himself is fair and just , and he declares sinners to be right in his sight when they believe in Jesus .
45003027	Can we boast , then , that we have done anything to be accepted by God ? No , because our acquittal is not based on obeying the law . It is based on faith .
45003028	So we are made right with God through faith and not by obeying the law .
45003029	After all , is God the God of the Jews only ? Isn’t he also the God of the Gentiles ? Of course he is .
45003030	There is only one God , and he makes people right with himself only by faith , whether they are Jews or Gentiles .
45003031	Well then , if we emphasize faith , does this mean that we can forget about the law ? Of course not ! In fact , only when we have faith do we truly fulfill the law .
45004001	Abraham was , humanly speaking , the founder of our Jewish nation . What did he discover about being made right with God ?
45004002	If his good deeds had made him acceptable to God , he would have had something to boast about . But that was not God’s way .
45004003	For the Scriptures tell us , “ Abraham believed God , and God counted him as righteous because of his faith . ”
45004004	When people work , their wages are not a gift , but something they have earned .
45004005	But people are counted as righteous , not because of their work , but because of their faith in God who forgives sinners .
45004006	David also spoke of this when he described the happiness of those who are declared righteous without working for it :
45004007	“ Oh , what joy for those whose disobedience is forgiven , whose sins are put out of sight .
45004008	Yes , what joy for those whose record the L ord has cleared of sin . ”
45004009	Now , is this blessing only for the Jews , or is it also for uncircumcised Gentiles ? Well , we have been saying that Abraham was counted as righteous by God because of his faith .
45004010	But how did this happen ? Was he counted as righteous only after he was circumcised , or was it before he was circumcised ? Clearly , God accepted Abraham before he was circumcised !
45004011	Circumcision was a sign that Abraham already had faith and that God had already accepted him and declared him to be righteouseven before he was circumcised . So Abraham is the spiritual father of those who have faith but have not been circumcised . They are counted as righteous because of their faith .
45004012	And Abraham is also the spiritual father of those who have been circumcised , but only if they have the same kind of faith Abraham had before he was circumcised .
45004013	Clearly , God’s promise to give the whole earth to Abraham and his descendants was based not on his obedience to God’s law , but on a right relationship with God that comes by faith .
45004014	If God’s promise is only for those who obey the law , then faith is not necessary and the promise is pointless .
45004015	For the law always brings punishment on those who try to obey it . ( The only way to avoid breaking the law is to have no law to break ! )
45004016	So the promise is received by faith . It is given as a free gift . And we are all certain to receive it , whether or not we live according to the law of Moses , if we have faith like Abraham’s . For Abraham is the father of all who believe .
45004017	That is what the Scriptures mean when God told him , “ I have made you the father of many nations . ” This happened because Abraham believed in the God who brings the dead back to life and who creates new things out of nothing .
45004018	Even when there was no reason for hope , Abraham kept hopingbelieving that he would become the father of many nations . For God had said to him , “ That’s how many descendants you will have ! ”
45004019	And Abraham’s faith did not weaken , even though , at about 100 years of age , he figured his body was as good as deadand so was Sarah’s womb .
45004020	Abraham never wavered in believing God’s promise . In fact , his faith grew stronger , and in this he brought glory to God .
45004021	He was fully convinced that God is able to do whatever he promises .
45004022	And because of Abraham’s faith , God counted him as righteous .
45004023	And when God counted him as righteous , it wasn’t just for Abraham’s benefit . It was recorded
45004024	for our benefit , too , assuring us that God will also count us as righteous if we believe in him , the one who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead .
45004025	He was handed over to die because of our sins , and he was raised to life to make us right with God .
45005001	Therefore , since we have been made right in God’s sight by faith , we have peace with God because of what Jesus Christ our Lord has done for us .
45005002	Because of our faith , Christ has brought us into this place of undeserved privilege where we now stand , and we confidently and joyfully look forward to sharing God’s glory .
45005003	We can rejoice , too , when we run into problems and trials , for we know that they help us develop endurance .
45005004	And endurance develops strength of character , and character strengthens our confident hope of salvation .
45005005	And this hope will not lead to disappointment . For we know how dearly God loves us , because he has given us the Holy Spirit to fill our hearts with his love .
45005006	When we were utterly helpless , Christ came at just the right time and died for us sinners .
45005007	Now , most people would not be willing to die for an upright person , though someone might perhaps be willing to die for a person who is especially good .
45005008	But God showed his great love for us by sending Christ to die for us while we were still sinners .
45005009	And since we have been made right in God’s sight by the blood of Christ , he will certainly save us from God’s condemnation .
45005010	For since our friendship with God was restored by the death of his Son while we were still his enemies , we will certainly be saved through the life of his Son .
45005011	So now we can rejoice in our wonderful new relationship with God because our Lord Jesus Christ has made us friends of God .
45005012	When Adam sinned , sin entered the world . Adam’s sin brought death , so death spread to everyone , for everyone sinned .
45005013	Yes , people sinned even before the law was given . But it was not counted as sin because there was not yet any law to break .
45005014	Still , everyone diedfrom the time of Adam to the time of Moseseven those who did not disobey an explicit commandment of God , as Adam did . Now Adam is a symbol , a representation of Christ , who was yet to come .
45005015	But there is a great difference between Adam’s sin and God’s gracious gift . For the sin of this one man , Adam , brought death to many . But even greater is God’s wonderful grace and his gift of forgiveness to many through this other man , Jesus Christ .
45005016	And the result of God’s gracious gift is very different from the result of that one man’s sin . For Adam’s sin led to condemnation , but God’s free gift leads to our being made right with God , even though we are guilty of many sins .
45005017	For the sin of this one man , Adam , caused death to rule over many . But even greater is God’s wonderful grace and his gift of righteousness , for all who receive it will live in triumph over sin and death through this one man , Jesus Christ .
45005018	Yes , Adam’s one sin brings condemnation for everyone , but Christ’s one act of righteousness brings a right relationship with God and new life for everyone .
45005019	Because one person disobeyed God , many became sinners . But because one other person obeyed God , many will be made righteous .
45005020	God’s law was given so that all people could see how sinful they were . But as people sinned more and more , God’s wonderful grace became more abundant .
45005021	So just as sin ruled over all people and brought them to death , now God’s wonderful grace rules instead , giving us right standing with God and resulting in eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
45006001	Well then , should we keep on sinning so that God can show us more and more of his wonderful grace ?
45006002	Of course not ! Since we have died to sin , how can we continue to live in it ?
45006003	Or have you forgotten that when we were joined with Christ Jesus in baptism , we joined him in his death ?
45006004	For we died and were buried with Christ by baptism . And just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glorious power of the Father , now we also may live new lives .
45006005	Since we have been united with him in his death , we will also be raised to life as he was .
45006006	We know that our old sinful selves were crucified with Christ so that sin might lose its power in our lives . We are no longer slaves to sin .
45006007	For when we died with Christ we were set free from the power of sin .
45006008	And since we died with Christ , we know we will also live with him .
45006009	We are sure of this because Christ was raised from the dead , and he will never die again . Death no longer has any power over him .
45006010	When he died , he died once to break the power of sin . But now that he lives , he lives for the glory of God .
45006011	So you also should consider yourselves to be dead to the power of sin and alive to God through Christ Jesus .
45006012	Do not let sin control the way you live ; do not give in to sinful desires .
45006013	Do not let any part of your body become an instrument of evil to serve sin . Instead , give yourselves completely to God , for you were dead , but now you have new life . So use your whole body as an instrument to do what is right for the glory of God .
45006014	Sin is no longer your master , for you no longer live under the requirements of the law . Instead , you live under the freedom of God’s grace .
45006015	Well then , since God’s grace has set us free from the law , does that mean we can go on sinning ? Of course not !
45006016	Don’t you realize that you become the slave of whatever you choose to obey ? You can be a slave to sin , which leads to death , or you can choose to obey God , which leads to righteous living .
45006017	Thank God ! Once you were slaves of sin , but now you wholeheartedly obey this teaching we have given you .
45006018	Now you are free from your slavery to sin , and you have become slaves to righteous living .
45006019	Because of the weakness of your human nature , I am using the illustration of slavery to help you understand all this . Previously , you let yourselves be slaves to impurity and lawlessness , which led ever deeper into sin . Now you must give yourselves to be slaves to righteous living so that you will become holy .
45006020	When you were slaves to sin , you were free from the obligation to do right .
45006021	And what was the result ? You are now ashamed of the things you used to do , things that end in eternal doom .
45006022	But now you are free from the power of sin and have become slaves of God . Now you do those things that lead to holiness and result in eternal life .
45006023	For the wages of sin is death , but the free gift of God is eternal life through Christ Jesus our Lord .
45007001	Now , dear brothers and sisters you who are familiar with the lawdon’t you know that the law applies only while a person is living ?
45007002	For example , when a woman marries , the law binds her to her husband as long as he is alive . But if he dies , the laws of marriage no longer apply to her .
45007003	So while her husband is alive , she would be committing adultery if she married another man . But if her husband dies , she is free from that law and does not commit adultery when she remarries .
45007004	So , my dear brothers and sisters , this is the point : You died to the power of the law when you died with Christ . And now you are united with the one who was raised from the dead . As a result , we can produce a harvest of good deeds for God .
45007005	When we were controlled by our old nature , sinful desires were at work within us , and the law aroused these evil desires that produced a harvest of sinful deeds , resulting in death .
45007006	But now we have been released from the law , for we died to it and are no longer captive to its power . Now we can serve God , not in the old way of obeying the letter of the law , but in the new way of living in the Spirit .
45007007	Well then , am I suggesting that the law of God is sinful ? Of course not ! In fact , it was the law that showed me my sin . I would never have known that coveting is wrong if the law had not said , “ You must not covet . ”
45007008	But sin used this command to arouse all kinds of covetous desires within me ! If there were no law , sin would not have that power .
45007009	At one time I lived without understanding the law . But when I learned the command not to covet , for instance , the power of sin came to life ,
45007010	and I died . So I discovered that the law’s commands , which were supposed to bring life , brought spiritual death instead .
45007011	Sin took advantage of those commands and deceived me ; it used the commands to kill me .
45007012	But still , the law itself is holy , and its commands are holy and right and good .
45007013	But how can that be ? Did the law , which is good , cause my death ? Of course not ! Sin used what was good to bring about my condemnation to death . So we can see how terrible sin really is . It uses God’s good commands for its own evil purposes .
45007014	So the trouble is not with the law , for it is spiritual and good . The trouble is with me , for I am all too human , a slave to sin .
45007015	I don’t really understand myself , for I want to do what is right , but I don’t do it . Instead , I do what I hate .
45007016	But if I know that what I am doing is wrong , this shows that I agree that the law is good .
45007017	So I am not the one doing wrong ; it is sin living in me that does it .
45007018	And I know that nothing good lives in me , that is , in my sinful nature . I want to do what is right , but I can’t .
45007019	I want to do what is good , but I don’t . I don’t want to do what is wrong , but I do it anyway .
45007020	But if I do what I don’t want to do , I am not really the one doing wrong ; it is sin living in me that does it .
45007021	I have discovered this principle of lifethat when I want to do what is right , I inevitably do what is wrong .
45007022	I love God’s law with all my heart .
45007023	But there is another power within me that is at war with my mind . This power makes me a slave to the sin that is still within me .
45007024	Oh , what a miserable person I am ! Who will free me from this life that is dominated by sin and death ?
45007025	Thank God ! The answer is in Jesus Christ our Lord . So you see how it is : In my mind I really want to obey God’s law , but because of my sinful nature I am a slave to sin .
45008001	So now there is no condemnation for those who belong to Christ Jesus .
45008002	And because you belong to him , the power of the life-giving Spirit has freed you from the power of sin that leads to death .
45008003	The law of Moses was unable to save us because of the weakness of our sinful nature . So God did what the law could not do . He sent his own Son in a body like the bodies we sinners have . And in that body God declared an end to sin’s control over us by giving his Son as a sacrifice for our sins .
45008004	He did this so that the just requirement of the law would be fully satisfied for us , who no longer follow our sinful nature but instead follow the Spirit .
45008005	Those who are dominated by the sinful nature think about sinful things , but those who are controlled by the Holy Spirit think about things that please the Spirit .
45008006	So letting your sinful nature control your mind leads to death . But letting the Spirit control your mind leads to life and peace .
45008007	For the sinful nature is always hostile to God . It never did obey God’s laws , and it never will .
45008008	That’s why those who are still under the control of their sinful nature can never please God .
45008009	But you are not controlled by your sinful nature . You are controlled by the Spirit if you have the Spirit of God living in you . ( And remember that those who do not have the Spirit of Christ living in them do not belong to him at all . )
45008010	And Christ lives within you , so even though your body will die because of sin , the Spirit gives you life because you have been made right with God .
45008011	The Spirit of God , who raised Jesus from the dead , lives in you . And just as God raised Christ Jesus from the dead , he will give life to your mortal bodies by this same Spirit living within you .
45008012	Therefore , dear brothers and sisters , you have no obligation to do what your sinful nature urges you to do .
45008013	For if you live by its dictates , you will die . But if through the power of the Spirit you put to death the deeds of your sinful nature , you will live .
45008014	For all who are led by the Spirit of God are children of God .
45008015	So you have not received a spirit that makes you fearful slaves . Instead , you received God’s Spirit when he adopted you as his own children . Now we call him , “ Abba , Father . ”
45008016	For his Spirit joins with our spirit to affirm that we are God’s children .
45008017	And since we are his children , we are his heirs . In fact , together with Christ we are heirs of God’s glory . But if we are to share his glory , we must also share his suffering .
45008018	Yet what we suffer now is nothing compared to the glory he will reveal to us later .
45008019	For all creation is waiting eagerly for that future day when God will reveal who his children really are .
45008020	Against its will , all creation was subjected to God’s curse . But with eager hope ,
45008021	the creation looks forward to the day when it will join God’s children in glorious freedom from death and decay .
45008022	For we know that all creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth right up to the present time .
45008023	And we believers also groan , even though we have the Holy Spirit within us as a foretaste of future glory , for we long for our bodies to be released from sin and suffering . We , too , wait with eager hope for the day when God will give us our full rights as his adopted children , including the new bodies he has promised us .
45008024	We were given this hope when we were saved . ( If we already have something , we don’t need to hope for it .
45008025	But if we look forward to something we don’t yet have , we must wait patiently and confidently . )
45008026	And the Holy Spirit helps us in our weakness . For example , we don’t know what God wants us to pray for . But the Holy Spirit prays for us with groanings that cannot be expressed in words .
45008027	And the Father who knows all hearts knows what the Spirit is saying , for the Spirit pleads for us believers in harmony with God’s own will .
45008028	And we know that God causes everything to work together for the good of those who love God and are called according to his purpose for them .
45008029	For God knew his people in advance , and he chose them to become like his Son , so that his Son would be the firstborn among many brothers and sisters .
45008030	And having chosen them , he called them to come to him . And having called them , he gave them right standing with himself . And having given them right standing , he gave them his glory .
45008031	What shall we say about such wonderful things as these ? If God is for us , who can ever be against us ?
45008032	Since he did not spare even his own Son but gave him up for us all , won’t he also give us everything else ?
45008033	Who dares accuse us whom God has chosen for his own ? No onefor God himself has given us right standing with himself .
45008034	Who then will condemn us ? No onefor Christ Jesus died for us and was raised to life for us , and he is sitting in the place of honor at God’s right hand , pleading for us .
45008035	Can anything ever separate us from Christ’s love ? Does it mean he no longer loves us if we have trouble or calamity , or are persecuted , or hungry , or destitute , or in danger , or threatened with death ?
45008036	( As the Scriptures say , “ For your sake we are killed every day ; we are being slaughtered like sheep . ” )
45008037	No , despite all these things , overwhelming victory is ours through Christ , who loved us .
45008038	And I am convinced that nothing can ever separate us from God’s love . Neither death nor life , neither angels nor demons , neither our fears for today nor our worries about tomorrownot even the powers of hell can separate us from God’s love .
45008039	No power in the sky above or in the earth belowindeed , nothing in all creation will ever be able to separate us from the love of God that is revealed in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45009001	With Christ as my witness , I speak with utter truthfulness . My conscience and the Holy Spirit confirm it .
45009002	My heart is filled with bitter sorrow and unending grief
45009003	for my people , my Jewish brothers and sisters . I would be willing to be forever cursedcut off from Christ ! if that would save them .
45009004	They are the people of Israel , chosen to be God’s adopted children . God revealed his glory to them . He made covenants with them and gave them his law . He gave them the privilege of worshiping him and receiving his wonderful promises .
45009005	Abraham , Isaac , and Jacob are their ancestors , and Christ himself was an Israelite as far as his human nature is concerned . And he is God , the one who rules over everything and is worthy of eternal praise ! Amen .
45009006	Well then , has God failed to fulfill his promise to Israel ? No , for not all who are born into the nation of Israel are truly members of God’s people !
45009007	Being descendants of Abraham doesn’t make them truly Abraham’s children . For the Scriptures say , “ Isaac is the son through whom your descendants will be counted , ” though Abraham had other children , too .
45009008	This means that Abraham’s physical descendants are not necessarily children of God . Only the children of the promise are considered to be Abraham’s children .
45009009	For God had promised , “ I will return about this time next year , and Sarah will have a son . ”
45009010	This son was our ancestor Isaac . When he married Rebekah , she gave birth to twins .
45009011	But before they were born , before they had done anything good or bad , she received a message from God . ( This message shows that God chooses people according to his own purposes ;
45009012	he calls people , but not according to their good or bad works . ) She was told , “ Your older son will serve your younger son . ”
45009013	In the words of the Scriptures , “ I loved Jacob , but I rejected Esau . ”
45009014	Are we saying , then , that God was unfair ? Of course not !
45009015	For God said to Moses , “ I will show mercy to anyone I choose , and I will show compassion to anyone I choose . ”
45009016	So it is God who decides to show mercy . We can neither choose it nor work for it .
45009017	For the Scriptures say that God told Pharaoh , “ I have appointed you for the very purpose of displaying my power in you and to spread my fame throughout the earth . ”
45009018	So you see , God chooses to show mercy to some , and he chooses to harden the hearts of others so they refuse to listen .
45009019	Well then , you might say , “ Why does God blame people for not responding ? Haven’t they simply done what he makes them do ? ”
45009020	No , don’t say that . Who are you , a mere human being , to argue with God ? Should the thing that was created say to the one who created it , “ Why have you made me like this ? ”
45009021	When a potter makes jars out of clay , doesn’t he have a right to use the same lump of clay to make one jar for decoration and another to throw garbage into ?
45009022	In the same way , even though God has the right to show his anger and his power , he is very patient with those on whom his anger falls , who are destined for destruction .
45009023	He does this to make the riches of his glory shine even brighter on those to whom he shows mercy , who were prepared in advance for glory .
45009024	And we are among those whom he selected , both from the Jews and from the Gentiles .
45009025	Concerning the Gentiles , God says in the prophecy of Hosea , “ Those who were not my people , I will now call my people . And I will love those whom I did not love before . ”
45009026	And , “ Then , at the place where they were told , ‘ You are not my people , ’ there they will be called ‘ children of the living God . ’ ”
45009027	And concerning Israel , Isaiah the prophet cried out , “ Though the people of Israel are as numerous as the sand of the seashore , only a remnant will be saved .
45009028	For the L ord will carry out his sentence upon the earth quickly and with finality . ”
45009029	And Isaiah said the same thing in another place : “ If the L ord of Heaven’s Armies had not spared a few of our children , we would have been wiped out like Sodom , destroyed like Gomorrah . ”
45009030	What does all this mean ? Even though the Gentiles were not trying to follow God’s standards , they were made right with God . And it was by faith that this took place .
45009031	But the people of Israel , who tried so hard to get right with God by keeping the law , never succeeded .
45009032	Why not ? Because they were trying to get right with God by keeping the law instead of by trusting in him . They stumbled over the great rock in their path .
45009033	God warned them of this in the Scriptures when he said , “ I am placing a stone in Jerusalem that makes people stumble , a rock that makes them fall . But anyone who trusts in him will never be disgraced . ”
45010001	Dear brothers and sisters , the longing of my heart and my prayer to God is for the people of Israel to be saved .
45010002	I know what enthusiasm they have for God , but it is misdirected zeal .
45010003	For they don’t understand God’s way of making people right with himself . Refusing to accept God’s way , they cling to their own way of getting right with God by trying to keep the law .
45010004	For Christ has already accomplished the purpose for which the law was given . As a result , all who believe in him are made right with God .
45010005	For Moses writes that the law’s way of making a person right with God requires obedience to all of its commands .
45010006	But faith’s way of getting right with God says , “ Don’t say in your heart , ‘ Who will go up to heaven ? ’ ( to bring Christ down to earth ) .
45010007	And don’t say , ‘ Who will go down to the place of the dead ? ’ ( to bring Christ back to life again ) . ”
45010008	In fact , it says , “ The message is very close at hand ; it is on your lips and in your heart . ” And that message is the very message about faith that we preach :
45010009	If you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead , you will be saved .
45010010	For it is by believing in your heart that you are made right with God , and it is by confessing with your mouth that you are saved .
45010011	As the Scriptures tell us , “ Anyone who trusts in him will never be disgraced . ”
45010012	Jew and Gentile are the same in this respect . They have the same Lord , who gives generously to all who call on him .
45010013	For “ Everyone who calls on the name of the L ord will be saved . ”
45010014	But how can they call on him to save them unless they believe in him ? And how can they believe in him if they have never heard about him ? And how can they hear about him unless someone tells them ?
45010015	And how will anyone go and tell them without being sent ? That is why the Scriptures say , “ How beautiful are the feet of messengers who bring good news ! ”
45010016	But not everyone welcomes the Good News , for Isaiah the prophet said , “ L ord , who has believed our message ? ”
